loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion always has enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income to help her husband in support of their family. At the age of 59 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. 

She has never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital which supports her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for fertilizer and compost for her growing crops. 

In the future, Concepcion wishes to own a motor cab for easy transport of her produce to any marketplace in town.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and compost for her growing crops

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is 64 years of age and a resident of So. Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with three kids. The family has a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they have realized that it is good to face the challenges together rather than get discouraged. 

Leoncio and his wife work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative a PHP 30,000 loan to buy an additional fishing boat and fishing nets to be handled by his nephew. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help should there be a need for working capital in the future. Leoncio smiles at the thought they can give a job to his nephew.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two dependents, now an adult and school age child. 

With a passion for cooking, she earns a living from the sales of her eatery business. She's been in this business for 10 years already and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month from her business. She has requested a loan to purchase additional meat, beef, vegetables, spices, seasoning and drinks for her existing eatery business. Teresita has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Teresita hopes to expand her eatery business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat, beef, vegetables, spices, seasoning and drinks

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 27 years old and single. She is living with her parents in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Ocidental. Marife earns an income through selling various seafood, like shellfish and seaweeds. This is how she helps her parents in supporting their needs. 

Marife is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her production. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her production.

loans.name: Cordapia

texts.en:
Cordapia earns a living running a beauty salon. She is 34 years old, single and lives in Eastern looc, Plaridel.  She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers, like hair color, hot oil and hair re-bond treatments. Her services are self-sustainable and her business has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 4000 per month.  

Cordapia is seeking a PHP 7,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for foot spa services. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few months. In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency in repayment. Cordapia is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase special items for foot spa services.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 1 child who is now adult- aged. 

Salud is a retired teacher by profession and has been receiving a monthly pension for almost 15 years already. At present, she is also receiving monthly rentals from rooms rented by occupants. She earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month as her regular monthly pension. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair. Salud has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years. In the future, Salud hopes to expand her room rentals business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a mother of two small children, her husband is a driver. 

For a living, Ailyn is operating a business which involves motor for hire or public transport in the local community, with her husband as the driver. She asked a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repair. In the future, Ailyn hopes to buy a new motorcycle unit for rental purposes. She believes that owning another vehicle will increase her income and would be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repair.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has 9 kids. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family. 

In 2008, Alicia applied for her membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always repays her loans on a timely manner.  Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase new fishing nets and apply additional capital towards her fishing business. She makes use of tiered foam in their fish vending and hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she believes to raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business. Alicia has found comfort in their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets and additional capital for her fishing business.

loans.name: Teodulo O

texts.en:
Teodulo resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  He is married and has four children. At the age of 63 he is still managing a transport business. He joined GDMPC in 2009.  Recently, he decided to borrow a loan amounting to Php7,000 to purchase some parts for his motorcycle maintenance, so that his motorcycle will be in a good condition and can generate more income from transporting more passengers.

Teodulo's future plan is to buy an additional motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to purchase some parts for his motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Semeon

texts.en: Semeon is 60 years old and married. He lives in Katipunan, Plaridel. For the past two decades, Semeon has been a farmer. He earns a good income each cropping season, enabling him to support his family. He is a new member of PMPC. Semeon is requesting a 7,500 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer for his rice farm. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of rice land to cultivate and potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina signed up her membership with Paglaum MPC and has availed financial assistance. As a farmer in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Florina feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, Florina availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Florina wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden wants to fulfill her dreams by completing  a degree. Her father is earning a living through agriculture, focusing on farming and hog raising activities. Eden religiously pays attention to making good marks every semester to pay off the sacrifices and hardships of her parents.

For another school year, Eden is in need of an amount to pay for her tuition and school fees. She has big dreams to help her family and for her siblings as well.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition and school fees

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celeste is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celeste has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Norma has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Geonalyn

texts.en:
Geonalyn is 29 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Geonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Geonalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Geonalyn has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Geonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and has eight children. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, salt, cooking oils, detergents, slippers, noodles, eggs, biscuits, milk, cigarettes and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

Lourdes opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, which will provide her with more working capital to buy more goods. She said with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she knows how to improve the management of her business. She also cultivates animals at her place like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, cooking oils, detergents, slippers, noodles, eggs, biscuits, milk, cigarettes, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda is a business woman.  She is married and has eight children.  There are ten members in the family.  Her husband is in agriculture.  

She has a kiosk and is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She will purchase additional items with the loan, including sugar, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, candles, milks, aqua, coffee and other things to sell, Including soft and hard drinks. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with working capital of $150.  She wants her business to grow bigger in the future.

Lucinda also has animals, like pigs and goats.

loans.use: To buy sugar, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, candles, milks, aqua, coffee and other things.

loans.name: Cony Yarret

texts.es: Doña Cony nació en la comunidad de El sardinal en el año de 1981 toda la vida a vivido en esa comunidad,estudió hasta cuarto grado de primaria y poco a poco fue aprendiendo con su mama las tareas del hogar y también a cortar café. Actualmente esta casada con Carlos y tiene 3 hijos. Ellos han trabajado en su área de tierra  y ellos tienen sembrado café y cosechan su café con toda la familia y también salen a cortar a las fincas cercanas café en la temporada de corte. En la comunidad de El  sardinal no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que ella compró una plante eléctrica de gasolina pero solo la enciende dos días a la semana ya que gasta mucho combustible al estar encendida, es por eso que Cony solicita un préstamo para la compra de un panel solar y así poder alumbrarse todas las noches y este panel solar seria de gran beneficio para toda la familia ya que los hijos están estudiando y para hacer las tareas por las noches le serviría bastante a ella también para realizar la cena por las noches comenta que estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este panel solar.
texts.en:
Cony was born in the El Sardinal community in the year 1981.  She has lived all of her life in this community.  She went to school through the fourth grade.  Little by little, she learned the household chores from her mother, and she learned to pick coffee.  She is currently married to Carlos, and she has three children.  They have worked on their part of the land, and they have planted coffee.  The whole family harvests the coffee.  

There is no electricity in the El Sardinal community.  That is why she bought a power plant that runs on gasoline.  However, she only turns it on two days a week because it wastes a lot of fuel when it is on.  It is for this reason that Conly is requesting a loan to buy a solar panel.  This way she will be able to  have light every night.  This solar panel will be a big help for all of the family.  It will help the children to do their homework in the evenings when they are studying.  It will also help her a lot when she is making dinner in the evenings.  She says that she would be very grateful if she is given the opportunity of this loan to buy a solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.fr:
Annociate fait partie du groupe Twiyubake et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 31 ans et est mariée à Thérence, un aide- maçon. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 13 ans, dont  3 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  bières de banane  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-septième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour la production de la bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle ,et voir ses enfants étudier.










.
texts.en:
Annociate belongs to group Twiyubake and lives in Gitega. She is 31 years old and married to Therence, a mason-helper. Together, they have four children aged 3 to 13. Three of them go to school.

She has retailed banana beer for twenty years. This is her seventeenth loan with Turame. With her kiva loan, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas with which to produce banana beer, to retail and earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a parcel and see her children study.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to produce banana beer to retail and earn more.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro owns a small herd of sheep and a few cows that produce the milk he sells on a daily basis. 

As the LP gas prices keep increasing, he was looking for a solution to reduce his operating costs and protect the environment. By purchasing a biodigester, he will be able to transform his animals' manure into a productive resource and become self-sufficient in his supply of energy and fertilizer. 

Indeed, he will be able to replace LP gas by methane-rich biogas, which will be directly connected to the boiler and cook stove in the house. In addition, the biodigester produces a potent and organic fertilizer, allowing Alejandro to increase the yield of his corn field in a sustainable way. As his farm becomes more cost-effective and productive, the fact that he treats his animals' manure and eliminates fossil fuels from his farm will also reduce Alejandro's carbon footprint. With his savings, he plans to buy more cows and continue saving to be able to face unforeseen events.

This loan represents 10% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 20-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Hearty

texts.en:
In 2009, Hearty had her first loan from PMPC.  She is from Plaridel, Philippines. Hearty is 54 years old and is married. She and her husband were stretching their resources to sustain the family needs, especially the education of her children. 
 
Her husband had the idea to start a bakery business, since they both have baking skills.  They had no starting capital. Hearty joined PMPC, after hearing that she could avail herself of financial assistance.  She applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital for their existing bakery business. With the help of PMPC, her business is slowly growing and has been doing well for years now.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers. And she has planned to save enough for her family. Hearty is thankful that her capital needs are being financed. In addition, she wants to expand and improve her business and hopes to live a happy, healthy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour and other raw ingredients to increase her production to provide for more customers

loans.name: Jaymart

texts.en:
Jaymart is a 23 years old and single. He has owned and managed a transport business for three years already. He joined GDMPC last 2014 and borrowed a loan of Php 7,000 to purchase parts for motor maintenance so that his motorcycle will be in a good condition. 

Jaymart's plan for the future is to purchase an additional motorcycle for his transport business for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 59 years old and married.  She has two children. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 36 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Jovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jovelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, cigarette, groceries, etc.

Jovelyn has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, cigarette, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando has several revenue-generating activities: he raises pigs and sells spicy pork sausages, while also working as a carpenter. He grows his own chili peppers on a field close to his home, where he also cultivates corn to feed his animals. He is looking forward to closing the natural cycle on his farm, by taking advantage of his pigs' manure to produce organic fertilizer that will allow him to increase the yield of his fields without purchasing any chemical fertilizers. In addition, the biogas will be directly connected to the cookstove and the boiler, allowing Fernando to displace the expensive LP gas. 

Fernando has been looking for waste treatment solutions for a long time, as hogs' manure is extremely contaminating, polluting underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases. His biodigester not only eliminates bad smells, but also treats the waste and turns it into a productive resource that allows Fernando to save money while improving his productivity.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Chary

texts.en:
Chary is 45 years old and has three children. He is married and has one child who currently in school.

Chary is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.  He requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for his pigs.  Chary has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Chary would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 29 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, rice, groceries, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, rice, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, coffee, soap, soft drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, coffee, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Arsenia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda is 61 years old and married, with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Wenifreda has been in this business for 17 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 50 years old and has seven children. Sally is married, and three of her children are still in school.

Sally is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Sally requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sally has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been involved in business since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $ 600.00. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens and cows. Maria is married and there are six members in the family: 4 children and her husband. Her husband is a security guard. 

Maria has a shop business. She is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies, including slippers, sugar, cooking oils, biscuits, detergents, noodles, sardines, milk, candies, cigarettes and other things to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sugar, cooking oils, biscuits, detergents, noodles, sardines, milk, candies, cigarettes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jati Ayu Group

texts.en:
The Jati Ayu group headed by Ni Nengah was able to meet its obligations to MUK although slightly delayed. This is because of the religious ceremony in the village. 

Ni Nengah, representing the members, said that this time, the effort had little benefit due to the rising feed prices, and the selling prices of pigs has now gone down. In addition, there are things that inhibit the growth of pigs so that the pig’s growth is not good. Even so, they do not give up in trying to overcome the problems they have in their own way so that their businesses can continue to operate smoothly. They also asked MUK, if allowed, to be given a loan that is larger than before so that they can rotate the capital and make their businesses run more smoothly.

Based on the evaluation of MUK’s staff, Jati Ayu group has not received an increase in the amount of the loan. However, they are very grateful still to be trusted to get a new loan. This loan was used to develop the business, particularly in raising pigs. Ni Nengah used the loan to buy superior quality piglets. She wants to expand her business. With the assistance of her husband, Ni Nengah is very excited to do her job. Ni Nengah hopes to get the maximum results so that she can be independent in terms of capital. 

One member could not attend the photo due to illness in the hospital.

loans.use: to buy superior quality piglets

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 53, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. At this time, she is working hard to sustain her financial expenses.

Susan operates a food vending business. A stationary food stand is essentially a conventional "storefront" operating full-time from a single location. Storefront carts, drive thru coffee trailers, indoor food kiosks, and street side food stands - to name only a few - are all considered stationary food stands. Like any business, her food stand stays in one location and waits for customers to come to it. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more types of food for her business, and as well as gas for cooking. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susan hopes that her business will continue to be successful as she wants her children to experience abundance and financial security in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and supplies she needs to continue to operate her food stall business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Agnes is 47 years old and two of her children are in school.

Agnes has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell in her business.

Agnes has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anamarie

texts.en:
Anamarie is 29 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Anamarie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Carell

texts.en:
Carell is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carell is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Carell has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell in her business.

Carell has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ma. Lucia

texts.en:
Ma. Lucia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lucia is 50 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Ma. Lucia has a buy-and-sell cosmetics business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cosmetics to sell.

Ma. Lucia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Mercedita has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loda

texts.en:
Loda is 48 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are still in school.

Loda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Loda has been in business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 41 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Diana requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Diana has been raising pigs for one year now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Diana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Pastor De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Pastor de Jesús Chavarría nació en el año de 1963 cuenta que nació en un lugar llamado la paz el Tuma. Estudió la escuela primaria y secundario y cuando termino su secundaria el decidió que tenía que seguir estudiando y prepararse así fue que decidió estudiar contabilidad. Pastor de Jesús tiene 6 hijos actualmente. Don Pastor tiene una propiedad en Abisinia en la cual siembra café y representa su  mayor parte de ingresos. Don Pastor trabaja en una empresa que habilita a productores de café esta empresa también lo habilita a Él para que tenga su café en buenas condiciones y esa misma empresa les compra el café a los productores. Le da gracias a Dios que lo ha bendecido con sus hijos con su familia. En la zona que El tiene la propiedad no hay luz eléctrica y para los tiempos de corte de café se hace bien difícil estarse alumbrando con foco es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poderlo instalar en la finca y vivir un poco diferente El y los muchachos que le cuidan la finca ya que ellos tiene hijos que están en clase en la escuela de la comunidad y ya con luz producida por el panel solar podrán alumbrarse y hacer las tareas que le dejan en clase, estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar y que beneficie a muchas personas.
texts.en:
Pastor de Jesus Chavarria was born in 1963 in a place called Paz de Tuma, he tells us. He studied in primary and secondary school and, upon finishing secondary, he decided that he had to continue studying to prepare himself in the field of accounting. He presently has six children. 

Pastor has property in Abisinia on which he sows coffee. This represents the major part of his income. Pastor also works in an enterprise that assists coffee producers. The enterprise also helps him to assure that his coffee will be in good condition. And this same enterprise purchases the coffee produced by these growers. 

Pastor gives thanks to God for his blessings for his children and his family. 

In the zone where Pastor has his property there is no electricity and at harvest time it is very difficult to have the required focused lighting.  This is why he is requesting a loan to purchase a solar system to install on his farm, so that he and his boys, who care for the farm, can live life quite differently. His boys now have children who are in school in the community. With the electricity produced by the solar panels, they will be able to have lights and they can do the homework assigned in class.

They would all be very grateful if offered this loan and the opportunity to buy a solar system which will benefit many people.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for his isolated farm where his children and grandchildren lack electricity.

loans.name: Nobelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nobelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Nobelinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase a whole pig for her butcher shop business.

Nobelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a whole pig for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is 35 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Ponciana works very hard to provide for them.

Ponciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as condiments, bread, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Ponciana has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Ponciana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as condiments, bread, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and dimension lumber, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Sari Rahayu Group

texts.en:
As in the agreement, the Sari Rahayu Group makes their payment on time. With ten members, they can make the payment together of 30,000,000 IDR. During the loan period, they can manage the pigs well. With the instructions from their vet, the group keeps the pigs by giving them nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Made sold her piglets and earned a net profit of 2,000,000 IDR. It’s all after deducting the cost of feed and making her payment. She’s really happy for that and decided to continue her loan to increase her population of pigs. All the profit is used for her family’s daily needs, repairing her house, and school fees.

After calculating and evaluating the last period, the Sari Rahayu Group decided to continue their loan. The loan will be used for increasing their pig businesses by purchasing new piglets or quality feed. The group received the same loan amount; each of them gets 3,000,000 IDR.

Ni Made is using her loan to purchase three super-quality piglets for fattening and to buy some merchandise for her kiosk. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan is running well.

She and the group still need advice and loan support for their businesses until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the businesses by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase three super-quality piglets and buy some merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had improved her business. She was able to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her computer shop. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could further improve her business, if you will let her borrow again, in the amount of PHP 10,000. This new loan will go to additional supplies of computer accessories and spare parts for her shop. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family, if the units are regularly maintained and in good condition.

Vilma is hoping that her profit will continue to increase and her business will thrive more. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Yolanda is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Yolanda has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Yolanda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, and her five children are currently in school.

Mylin has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Mylin has been in this business for six years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear, a general store, and buying and selling charcoal.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Don Juan nació en un lugar llamado Bocaysito en el año de 1958,  el no pudo estudiar ya que los padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y se dedico a ayudarles a trabajar,desde pequeño trabajaba en cortes de café y sembraban granos básicos para consumo. Actualmente esta casado y tiene 7 hijos. Actualmente don Juan vive en la comunidad de El Sardinal y tiene una finca donde siembra café y granos básicos para consumo y venta .Trabaja la tierra con sus hijos y su señora.En esta comunidad del sardinal uno no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y así poder vivir un poco mas diferente él y su familia ya se podrán alumbrar por las noches y las madrugadas la señora comenta don Juan que se tiene que estar alumbrando con foco y candelas y no alumbran casi nada y así con el sistema solar ya podrá alumbrarse un poco mejor. Estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Don Juan was born in a place called Bocaysito in 1958.  He was not able to attend school because his parents had little financial resources and he dedicated himself to helping them work.  From a young age he worked cutting coffee and planting basic beans and grains for consumption.  

Now he is married and has seven children.  Currently Don Juan lives in the El Sardinal community and has a farm where he plants coffee and basic beans and grains for consumption and sale.  He works the land with his children and his wife.  

In the El Sardinal community there is no electric lighting.  This is why he asks for a loan to buy a solar energy system and thus be able to live a little bit differently.  Juan and his family would be able to light up the night and the dawn.  Don Juan says his wife has to use a light bulb and candles, and these hardly illuminate anything.  Thus, with the solar energy system he will be able to have better lighting.  He would be very grateful to be given the opportunity to get a loan in order to buy this solar energy system.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Chamangul

texts.ru:
Это Чамангул. Она проживает в районе Восеъ. У нее не большая семья. Муж, три сыновей и две дочери. Сыновьям 20,18 и 12 лет. Дочкам 17 и 15 лет. Муж и старший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Младший сын бизнесмен, и он занимается один видом бизнеса. Дочки ходят в школу. Ее невестка домохозяйка, она ведет домашние хозяйство. 
Чамила 5 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. У нее есть коровник, где она ухаживает скотам. Она покупает молодых телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Вот так она трудится, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Заниматься этой деятельностью нелегко, но Чамангул хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она берет кредит, чтобы продвигаться дальше  и зарабатывать для жизни.
texts.en: This is Chamangul. She lives in the Vose district with her large family, consisting of her husband, three sons, and two daughters. Her sons are ages 12, 18, and 20, and her daughters are 15 and 17. Her husband and eldest son work in Russia and her youngest son is a businessman. Her daughters both go to school. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker and manages the household. Chamangul started raising livestock five years ago and has a barn where she keeps cattle. She buys young calves, fattens them for a few months, and then sells them at the livestock market. The income from this business supports the family. This is not an easy business, but Chamangul is successful in her work. She is taking out a loan to advance her business and earn a living.

loans.use: to buy young calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP.  This new loan will go to additional grocery items, beverages and toiletries she needs to expand her product inventory. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Irenea wants to have business expansion so that she can continue to provide their daily needs and pay their expenses. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Los Amigos De Chontamocco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS AMIGOS DE CHONTAMOCCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Raquel ella es soltera y tiene 35 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva platanos, cafe, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank called "LOS AMIGOS DE CHONTAMOCCO” which is located in the Huayopata district in the province of La Convencion, department of Cusco. 

One of the members is Raquel who is 35 years old, single, and has one son. She is a fruit grower and has a plot of land where for the past number of years she has been growing plantains, coffee, tangerines, and oranges. Raquel works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and her business does very well.Her dream is to have a larger plot of land. She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The other member of the bank work in such businesses as selling animals, agriculture, grocery store, and food sales.

Raquel is grateful to everyone who has been a part of her dream by granting her a loan, and she promises to make all of her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is 31 years old and married. She has two children who are in school.

Nelinda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Nelinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelinda has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelinda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 40 years old and married.  She has five children. With three children in school, Angelita works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, bread, condiments, canned goods, etc..

Angelita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.  In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, bread, condiments, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and married.  She has three children. One child is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, groceries, etc.

Rosita has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and to pay for laborers' salaries for cleaning the rice field for her farming rice business.

Elsie has been in this business for six years. Elsie earns additional income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and to pay for laborers' salaries for cleaning rice field

loans.name: Jofalyn

texts.en:
Jofalyn is 27 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jofalyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Jofalyn has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 39 years old and married.  She has five children.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Analiza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Analiza has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Jose vive en casa propia con sus grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose lives in his own house with his family. He has made a living for several years in agriculture by farming corn and millet. By harvest time, he had already marketed in the surrounding villages, and had many regular customers. With the profits he earned, he is managing to get ahead.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest controls, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. He can thereby continue with his farming, because that is his only source of work, and thus have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest controls, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Mohruhsor

texts.en:
Mohruhsor is a generous woman. She is living in a rural area. She is single. She is a worker. She works at the Central Library. There is a story behind how she got sick. She has low pressure inside her brain. 

She wants to take a 3000 somoni loan for her treatment in hospital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To take a treatment in hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Lersin Otmir

texts.es:
Lersin tiene 21 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo vive en casa alquilada la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún en la provincia de Chilayo en la región de Lambayeque - costa norte de Perú, este distrito se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio de animales, dicho lugar es una zona rural.

Lersin se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos hace 6 meses, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de más medicamentos para tener un stock surtido y cubrir la demanda de estos; con lo que obtendrá mejores resultados económicos y asi mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lersin is 21 years old. His civil status is single, and he has no children to care for. He lives in a rented house located in the district of Oyotún in the province of Chilayo, in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Perú. The people in this district make a living in agriculture and animal commerce, and this district is a rural area.

Lersin has been making a living selling pharmaceutical products for 6 months. He has business experience, and very good personal and professional recommendations in the area. He is requesting a loan to buy more medicine in order to have an assorted inventory to meet the demands of his customers. With this, he will earn more money, and improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy more medicine in order to have an assorted inventory to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Templarios Group

texts.es:
Valeria es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo varón de 8 años y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, generosa, responsable, fuerte, y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la localidad de ‘Punata’ donde la mayoría de la población es católica, y el idioma que se habla es el Quechua, de clima templado en verano y en invierno los fríos son intensos y húmedos.
Valeria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, usa polera verde). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus 2 hijos; que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches y tienda de barrio,  para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para niños de segunda mano, ella selecciona; buzos deportivos, chamarras, poleras, conjuntos para bebe y todo aquello que sea para público infantil, “los niños rompen la ropa constantemente y por eso los padres prefieren elegir ropa de segunda mano que es más accesible…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda de ropa para dejar de ambular, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa infantil de segunda mano por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y con los beneficios satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Valeria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano  y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Valeria is 44 years old, married and has an 8 year old son and a 10 year old daughter. She works selling used clothing. She is a good mother patient, generous, responsible, strong and a hard-worker.

She does business itinerantly in the community of 'Punata' where the majority of the population is Catholic and the language spoken is Quechua. It has a warm climate in summer and in winter the cold is intense and humid.

Valeria is dark-skinned, short in stature, with black eyes and thin (she is wearing a green t-shirt in the picture). Her native language is Quechua which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her work. She shared her life with her spouse who works in construction and with her two children who study in school. They live in a rented brick house with a reed roof that has well water and electricity.

Her dreams of getting ahead led her to heading a communal bank of people with businesses like; the sale of sandwiches and a neighborhood store. They got together to request a loan to expand their businesses.

Her business is selling second hand clothing for children. She selects jogging suits, sweaters, polo shirts, baby outfits and everything made for babies. " babies constantly wear out their clothing so for this reason parents prefer second hand clothing which is more accessible" she commented. Her dream is to have her own clothing store so she can stop moving around.

She wants to invest in her business through buying second hand clothing for babies wholesale to increase her sales and with the profits fulfill the needs of her children. This is her second loan with the institution in the four years she has been in this business. For these reasons Valeria is requesting a loan to buy second hand clothing and with the profits pay for the school expenses of her 2 children.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing and pay the school expenses of her two children with the profits.

loans.name: Liseth Veronica

texts.es:
Liseth tiene 26 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a sus hijos en la provincia de Morropón que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ademas de el comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de helados, bebidas y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientela fija a quien entrega pedidos de ropa. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como helados, bebidas y ropa, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Liseth espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Liseth is 26 years old and lives at home with her children in the province of Morropón, which is located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the community is quiet and residents are engaged in agriculture and trade.

Liseth sells ice cream, beverages, and clothing for men, women, and children. She began this activity more than two years ago. She has experience in her business and has a fixed clientele who order clothing from her. The loan will be used to purchase products such as ice cream, drinks, and clothing to increase the stock of her business. With this loan, Liseth hopes to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, which will have a great impact on her income level to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of ice cream, beverages, and clothing

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising pigs. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell for her ginger retailing business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is 31 years old and has five children. She is married, and four of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analina has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business. Maricel has been in this business for two years. Maricel earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 56 years old and married.  She has eight children.  Lourdes is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gundina

texts.en:
Gundina is a married woman with thirteen children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gundina is 54 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Gundina has a buy-and-sell cosmetics business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cosmetic products to sell.

Gundina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Luz has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es:
Luz Angela es una joven emprendedora campesina, sonriente, una capacidad para trabajar impresionante, y madre de un pequeño de 10 años de edad, por el cual trabaja inclusive más duro pues quiere que asista a la universidad y no pase por las necesidades que en su niñez paso.
Se desempeña como criadora de ganado bovino, en otras palabras es productora de leche, una actividad muy desagradecida debido a que el costo de una vaca es altísimo y el precio de litro de leche está muy desvalorizado.
Angela quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de terneras de levante, la razón del monto es justificado con el elevado costo que tienen estos animales, si logra hacer efectivo su solicitud de ayuda, podrá tener mejores herramientas para buscar un mejor futuro para su hijo, tener sostenibilidad de negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vivienda de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luz Angela is an enterprising, smiling, young countrywoman.  She has an impressive capacity for work.  She is the single mother of a little ten year old.  It is for him that she works even harder because she wants him to attend the university, and she does not want him to do without as she did in her youth.

She works caring for cattle.  In other works, she is a milk producer.  This business activity is not very gratifying because the cost of a cow is very high, and the price of a liter of milk has fallen a lot.

Angela wants to request a loan to buy calves to raise.  The amount is justified by the elevated costs for these animals.  If she manages to get the requested help, she will be able to have better tools to look for a better future for her son, to have sustainability in her business, and to improve the living conditions of her home.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a small Mexican dairy farmer. He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of his cows' manure and displace the expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers and wood he used to buy for his farm's operations. By inputting his cows' manure in the biodigester, he will produce his own biogas, which will be directly connected to the cookstove and the boiler in the house. In addition, the manure will also be transformed into nutrient-rich, organic fertilizer, which will allow Alejandro to increase the yield of his field in a natural way. As he treats his animals' waste and makes fossil fuels irrelevant, he will not only protect the environment, reduce health risks due to the inhalation of toxic smoke on a daily basis, but also save money. With his savings, Alejandro plans to build a stable, and to save in order to improve the facilities for the cows as well as their feed.
This loan represents 9% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is single and lives with her parents. She works as a credit analyst for a few years now. She support her family and takes care of her parents,both of them are retired. She developed a hereditary cornea problem that affects her to focus on near and far side objects, this eye problem is affecting her on her daily activities.The only option for her is to have an eye surgery. She is asking for a loan to have her eye surgery performed. Monica is having an eye exam in the picture.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married, and mother of three children. She takes care of her family while her husband works in a small family business. She is a dedicated mother and excellent wife. Her oldest son has developed a vision problem that is affecting him on his school activities, he cannot see from a far and near distance. Recently they went to have a vision exam and he was a good candidate to have the surgery to correct his vision problem, due to economic reasons she was unable to afford the surgery. She is asking for this loan to help her son to pay his eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un muchacho de 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Julio es muy dedicado a su familia y cada día trabaja fuertemente para generar sus ingresos económicos, el trabajo que realiza Julio es que él trabaja para una empresa privada como seguridad él se dedica a esto desde hace 6 años pero según cuenta Julio que también tiene un café internet en su comunidad, para él esta otra actividad es bastante rentable, pues lo ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
La meta de Julio es comprar un terreno ya que el aún no cuenta   con una familia propia y así podrá ofrecerle a su familia algún día una mejor vida, pero ahora los terrenos tienen un precio bastante elevado, y una de las limitaciones de Julio es que no cuenta con la cantidad suficiente para poder hacerlo, entonces el necesita de un prestamo, porque le están ofreciendo un terreno y es ahí mismo en su comunidad, Julio planteo con sus padres y ellos están de interesados en conseguir el prestamo, para invertirlo en la compra del terreno que están anhelando, la mentalidad de Julio es que más adelante  pueda construir su casa, para cuando él decida formar su propia familia ya cuente con su propia casa
texts.en:
Julio is a 27-year-old man who is single and lives in the Nahuala community. Julio is very dedicated to his family and works hard every day in order to generate income.  Julio works for a private security-like business.  He has had this job for six years but, according to Julio, he also has an internet cafe in his community. For him, this other work is quite profitable since it helps him get his family ahead in life.

Julio's goal is to buy a plot of land since he does not yet have his own family, and thus he will be able to one day offer them a better life.  But right now land has quite a high price, and one of his limitations is that he does not have a sufficient amount to be able to do this.  Thus, he is in need of a loan because there is a plot of land available and it is right in his community.  Julio presented this to his parents and they are interested in getting the loan in order to purchase the land that they are wishing for. Julio's thinking is that in the future he can build a home so that when he decides to form his own family he will already have his own house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and father of two children, lives with his family. He's been working in a construction company for a few years now. He works hard to support his family. He has developed cataracts in the eyes which is really common, this eye problem is affecting his vision, the only option for him is to have surgery but due to the high cost he couldn't have the surgery done in the past. He is using this loan to pay his eye surgery. Fernando is having an eye exam in the picture.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerador

loans.name: Estrellas Del Valle Group

texts.es:
Con la necesidad de capitalizar los negocios y expandir sus ventas, surge un grupo compuesto por seis mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que desde muy temprana edad conocen lo que es trabajar arduamente, personas que tienen altos valores morales fortalecidos en el vivir de la zona rural, llenas de ánimos y gozo forman el grupo Estrellas del Valle, que es dirigido y organizado por la coordinadora Belcky una joven emprendedora con una sola visión en la vida alcanzar el éxito, ya que a sus 24 años ha dedicado parte de su vida a su negocio que es la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos, negocio con el cual ayuda al núcleo familiar, por tal razón desea invertir en cremas corporales, perfumes, colonias, vanidades, pinturas labiales, rubores, delineadores, etc.
Las otras integrantes son Oneyda de 30 años de edad y con tres años de experiencia en la venta de ropa y calzado en su comunidad, Magda una joven de 21 años que vende ropa de segunda en su comunidad desde hace cinco años ella compra la mercadería en uno de los mercados de la capital y los distribuye en su comunidad, la señora Ada de 44 años que ofrece el servicio de venta de comida, que prepara con ingredientes comprados en el mercado de la municipalidad y vende los platillos en una de las zonas turísticas del departamento desde hace catorce años, Haydee una señora de 35 años, quien vende perecederos desde hace seis años en el mercado de la municipalidad, negocio con el cual aporta a la economía de la familia, y Ana de 30 años de edad, quien vende ropa nueva y calzado nacional con cinco años de experiencia vendiendo en las comarcas aledañas a su domicilio. Estas seis mujeres tienen bien claro que el trabajo en sus negocios son las que las mantienen felices y por eso necesitan un financiamiento para seguir creciendo y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
With the necessity of capitalizing the businesses and increasing sales, a group composed of six hard-working and struggling women, who knew from a young age what it means to work arduously, arose.  They are people with high moral values fortified by living in a rural zone.  Full of spirit and joy, they form the group Estrellas del Valle, which is directed and organized by the coordinator Belcky, an enterprising young woman with the single vision in life to succeed.  Since she is 24 years old, she has decided to dedicate part of her life to her business which is clothing and cosmetics sales.  It is a business with which she helps her nuclear family and for this reason she wishes to invest in body creams, perfumes, colognes, vanities, lipstick, blushes, delineators, etc. 
The other partners are: Oneyda, 30, has three years of experience in the sales of clothing and shoes in her community. Magda, 21, has been selling second hand clothing in her community for five years.  She buys the merchandise in one of the markets in the capital and distributes it in her community.  Ada, 44, offers the service of the sale of food, which she prepares with ingredients purchased in the municipal market and has been selling the dishes in one of the tourist zones of the department for fourteen years.  Haydee, 35, has been selling perishables for six years in the municipal market, a business which helps out the family economy.  Ana, 30, has been selling new clothing and national footwear for five years in the regions surrounding her residence.  These six women know well that work in their businesses is what makes them happy and for this reason they need a loan to continue growing and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy vanities, body cream, delineators, perfumes, etc. with the aim of increasing her working capital..

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1 es un grupo nuevo formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona aun en crecimiento, de difícil acceso y con muchas carencias.
La Sra. Juana es una humilde persona, que se está esforzando por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos y otros, y con ello tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna.
Juana pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para la cría, como ser gallinas y cerdos, con lo cual podrá seguir con la cría de animales y luego venderlos.
texts.en:
The group, called KUÑA GUAPA, is in its cycle number one. It is a new group, formed in the town of Curuguaty. This town is still growing, is not easily accessible, and has a lot of poverty.

Sra. Juana is a humble person, who is striving to be able to give her family everything that she could not have. She makes a living raising and selling livestock, such as hens, pigs, and others, in order to have the means to give her loved ones a decent life. 

Juana requests this loan to buy animals for breeding, such as hens and pigs, with which she can continue to raise animals and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as pigs and hens, for raising and selling.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Doña Catalina tiene 60 años, es madre soltera, vive en la ciudad de Itá juntos con sus hijos y nietos todos ya mayores de edad, es una mujer que se ha esforzado siempre, todo esto para poder dar a su familia una vida digna.
Ella se dedica al comercio de venta de ropas y servicios de alquiler de sillas, mesas, cubiertos y decoraciones en general, ya más de 13 años aproximadamente. Es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas varias y también para la compra de sillas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Catalina is 60 years old and is a single mother. She lives in the city of Itá with her children and grandchildren who are all grown up. She is a women who has always striven to give her family a dignified life.

She makes a living in the business of clothing sales and the rental of chairs, tables, cutlery and general decorations, already for more than about 13 years. She is a very strong and entrepreneurial woman.

She asks for this loan to buy various clothes and also to buy chairs for her business.

loans.use: to buy various clothes and chairs for her rental service.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He has been engaged in buying and selling recycled materials for two years. His income covers the school allowances of his three children. Rolly and his wife have been working hard to provide their family with basic commodities. Having insufficient capital, he wishes for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos to purchase used plastic bottles, steel, old tires, and scrap materials to sell. He believes that the additional capital will help him improve his business and his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase used plastic bottles, steel, old tires, and scrap materials for his buy and sell business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair computer equipment.

loans.name: Welcita

texts.en:
Welcita is 53 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Welcita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Welcita has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a manicure/pedicure service.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Vilma has a pineapple fiber weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more pineapple fiber to use for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more piña fiber to used for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old, and married with three children.
