Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Victoria has had 10 loans from NWTF, which she has repaid,  before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years, and also earns income from selling dried fish.

Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: María Rosina

texts.es:
María Rosina es una mujer veterana de 58 años de edad, la cual vive actualmente en la ciudad de Medellín, es separada, crio y levanto a un hijo que ya tiene 30 años de edad la cual es su única familia. Inicio un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en el año 2000, por necesidad económica y porque siempre se mostró atraída por crear empresa.
Sus aspiraciones en futuro es llevar una vida tranquila, seguir con su tienda, tener para comer, para mantener el hogar y disfrutar de una feliz vejez al lado de su segunda familia que son sus vecinos y personas cercanas que diariamente la visitan para adquirir algún producto.
María quiere solicitar un crédito, la razón es para abastecer su negocio con granos, productos de aseo y algunos productos de refrigeración.
Este aporte le servirá para surtir su negocio y tener existencia para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Rosina is a lady of 58 years of age who lives in the city of Medellín. She is separated from her husband and has brought up a son who is now 30 years old and is her only family. She started a grocery store business in the year 2000 because she needed to for financial reasons and because she has always been attracted to the idea of setting up a business. 

Her ambitions for the future are to live a quiet life, continue with her store, have enough to eat, to look after her home and enjoy a happy old age with her second family, which consists of her neighbors and people nearby who visit her every day to buy one of her products. 

The reason María is requesting this loan is in order to stock her business with basic foodstuffs, toiletries and some refrigerated products. This contribution will help her supply her business to keep it going and satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, toiletries and refrigerated produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Miguel Alfonso

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Miguel, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.
El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 7 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja con un familiar todos los días durante 8 horas.
Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.
Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.
El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.
Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.
Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Selling fruits and vegetables is Miguel's business.  He is a man with the drive and perseverance to get his business and family ahead. 

He has had this business for over seven years, working very early in the morning every day to offer his produce. 

He works with a family member every day for eight hours. 

He decided to start this business in light of his need to make more income for his family and, as he did not have the education for other work, he decided to sell fruits and vegetables. 

She is a kind and helpful man who is always ready to see her customers' concerns and wishes. 

He is requesting a loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy a large supple of vegetables and thereby stock and sell a greater quantity of produce. 

His dream is to have a space where he can sell his produce peacefully and comfortably. 

Lend and contribute today; go for it!

loans.use: to buy a large supply of vegetables for his business

loans.name: Geovanny Alexander

texts.es:
Geovanny, de 22 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor y albañil desde hace cuatro años, su nivel académico llega hasta bachillerato, actualmente está acompañado y tiene un hijo el cual tiene dos años de edad y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Geovanny, se desempeña como agricultor, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su padre, que también es agricultor y de su tío aprendió a trabajar en construcción ,así que de esta manera es como ha empezado a desarrollarse económicamente. 

El dinero de este crédito será para pagarle a un vecino, un préstamo que le hizo para comprar láminas para el techo de su vivienda.

El sueño que tiene es pagar la deuda de su amigo y luego pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Geovanny is 22 years old, and has worked as a farmer and a brick mason for 4 years. He has a high school education level. He is currently in a relationship, has a 2-year-old child, and his partner works on the household chores.

Geovanny works as a farmer. He learned this occupation from his father who is also a farmer, and he learned to work in construction from his uncle. In this way he has started to make progress financially.

The money from this loan will be used to repay a neighbor for a loan that he was given to buy metal sheets for the roof of his home. His dream is to repay the debt to his friend and then repay this loan.

loans.use: to repay a neighbor for a loan that he was given to buy metal sheets for the roof of his home.

loans.name: Armida De Jesús

texts.es:
Armida, de 50 años de edad, es viuda y con ella viven solo dos de sus hijos, que están estudiando, con ella también vive su hermana.

Armida, vende tortillas, este oficio lo aprendió por medio de su hermana, también vende refrescos naturales.- El negocio lo tiene en su casa y con ella trabaja su hijo y su hermana. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una hielera y una plancha más para hacer tortillas.

Sus sueños son, tener una tienda para tener más ingresos y darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Armida, age 50, is a widow.  Only two of her children live with her, and they go to school.  Her sister also lives with her.

Armida sells tortillas.  She learned this occupation from her sister.  She also sells natural soft drinks.  She has the business at her house.  Her son and her sister work with her.

She needs the loan to buy a cooler and one more griddle to make tortillas.

Her dreams are to have a store in order to have more income and to give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and one more griddle to make tortillas.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, es madre soltera, tuvo 4 hijos, pero ya murió uno, los otros son mayores de edad y ya no viven con ella, en su casa solo vive un sobrino y su madre que es una señora de avanzada edad, con problemas de salud a quien ella la cuida.

Rosa, tuvo que trabajar en la agricultura para mantener a sus hijos, ahora su sobrino que vive con ella, trabaja y le apoya.

Rosa, necesita el dinero para pagar el alquiler de la tierra en donde sembrara.

Rosa, le gustaría mantenerse siempre con fuerza para trabajar, porque siente que las fuerzas se agotan con el tiempo.
texts.en: Rosa is 53 years old. She studied through first grade. She is a single mother and has 4 children but one of them died. The other children are adults who do not live with her. She lives with a nephew and her aging mother who has health problems and who is under her care. Rosa had to work in agriculture to support her children, now her nephew who lives with her works and helps her. Rosa needs the loan to rent the land where she will sow. Rosa would like to have the strength to continue working, because she feels that the strength becomes exhausted with time.

loans.use: To pay the rent for the land where she will sow.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad.

Rafael, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años, anteriormente solo era empleado de una empresa distribuidora de gas.- Generalmente, siempre se ha dedicado a trabajos en el campo, ya que desde pequeño ha trabajado con su padre en cultivos de maíz y frijol.

El préstamo lo utilizara para reparar su casa, con esta ayuda podrá realizar ese trabajo.

Rafael, sueña con obtener un nuevo empleo y seguir mejorando su vivienda y darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is 26 years old and studied until the fourth grade. He is accompanied by his partner and makes a living in the offices of his home. He has two children who are 3 and 5 years old.

Rafael has made a living in agriculture for 3 years. Previously he was only employed by a business that distributed gas. Generally, he has always made a living in field work. Since he was young he has worked with his father in the cultivations of corn and beans.

The loan will be used to make repairs in his house, and with this help he will be able to perform this job.

Rafael plans to look for a new job and continue to improve his home and give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to make repairs in his home

loans.name: Dilcia Marina

texts.es: Con la ayuda económica que fue financiada por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA Dilcia pudo comprar los diferentes insumos como: nutricafe, abono 18-46-0 y abono foliar los cuales fueron aplicados a sus cultivos de café para obtener una excelente cosecha con la cual pudo cancelar su compromiso de manera satisfactoria. Dilcia está muy agradecida y contenta por este apoyo brindado y actualmente solicita su segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá en sus cultivos de café nuevamente comprando fertilizantes y otra parte para el pago de mano de obra calificada para asistir sus cultivos de café. Dilcia espera en esta nueva ocasión ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva ya que esta clase de financiamientos dan oportunidad al pequeño productor de crecer y salir adelante con sus planes, metas y esperanzas a alcanzar.
texts.en:
With the financial assistance provided by the cooperative COMIXMUL in alliance with the different investors from the Kiva platform, Dilcia was able to buy different supplies such as nutricafe, manure 18-46-0 and leaf manure which were applied to her coffee crops in order to obtain an excellent crop with which she was able to fulfill her obligation in a satisfactory manner.

Dilcia is very grateful and content with the assistance offered and now is requesting her second financing which she will invest in her coffee crop once again to buy fertilizers and another part to pay the labor qualified to tend to her coffee crop. Dilcia hopes to be supported by the different investors on the Kiva platform on this new occasion since this kind of financing gives small producers the opportunity to grow and get ahead with their plans, goals and wishes to achieve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the labor to tend her coffee crop in this new season.

loans.name: Erika Cecilia

texts.en:
Erika Cecilia is 38 years old. She is a lawyer and works for a Mexican electric company. 

She is starting a small civil law firm with her father, and she is asking for a loan to cover some working capital needs. She describes herself as very responsible, and her goal is to become independent and grow her own business.

loans.use: to raise working capital for a small law firm that she is starting.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es casado tienen 56 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez, tiene una hermosa familia de 6 hijos de las edades de  entre 15 y 30 años, pero cuatro de ellos ya se encuentran casados.
Julian a pesar de su avanzada edad, trabaja para el progreso de su familia, el desde hace 25 años se dedica a la carpintería, a él le  gusta este trabajo pues él lo empezó a realizar desde muy joven, Julian y su esposa se han ayudado mutuamente para sacar adelante a su familia, Julian ahora quiere construir su casa para que su familia deje de parecer de incomodidades pero con lo que el obtienen de su trabajo no le alcanza para construir su casa, por tal motivo solicita un prestamo para comprar materiales de construcción tales como: arena, piedrín, hierro, cemento y todo lo que la construcción   necesite.
El sueño de Julian es poder construir su casa este año, para tener un mejor lugar donde pueda realizar sus productos que como carpintero realiza.
texts.en:
Julian is 56 years old and married. He lives in a community in Suchitepéquez. He has a beautiful family with 6 children between 15 and 30 years old. Four of his children are already married. 

Despite his age, Julian works to help his family progress. He has enjoyed working as a carpenter for 25 years and started very young. Julian and his wife have both worked equally hard to help the family progress. Julian now wants to build a house so that his family is more comfortable. From what he earns from his job he cannot afford to build the house, and for this reason he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as: sand, piedrin (a type of building stone), iron, cement and everything that the building work would require. 

Julian's dream is to be able to build his house this year in order to have a better place to carry out his work as a carpenter.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron and piedrin (a type of building stone).

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.ru: Аронби вместе семьей проживает в городе Куляб. У нее не прекрасная семья. Муж и двое детей. Дети ходят в школу. Муж работает охранником. Анорби сама занимается шитьем у себя дома. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Уже на протяжении 3 лет она занимается шитьем женских платьев национального стиля. Анорби любит свою работу и хорошо справляется с ней. По ее словам ей удобно шить на дому, так как она дополнительно может параллельно вести по домашнее хозяйство и присматривать за детьми. Анорби хочет купить современную швейную машинку, чтобы продвигаться дальше. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Anorbi and her family live together in the city of Kulob.  She has a wonderful family consisting of her husband and two children.  Her children attend a secondary school.  Her husband works as a security guard.  As for Anorbi, she works as a seamstress sewing Tajik women's dresses out of home.  She is a very hardworking woman, and has plied her trade for the past three years.  

Anorbi loves her job, and is very good at what she does.  In her own words, it's comfortable for her to work as a seamstress out of home as she can tend to the household chores as well as her children at the same time.  She wants to buy a new, modern sewing machine to be able to progress further, and is seeking a loan to this end.

loans.use: buy a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is a business woman. She was born in 1986. She is living in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is a shepherd. Dilorom is a hardworking and active woman. She has been buying and selling livestock for about three years. She loves her activity. She is planning to extend her business. She wants to buy cattle for more benefit for her business. Dilorom is asking for financial support from Kiva project to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kurbonbi

texts.ru:
Курбонби жительница района Яван. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее две дочери и один сын. Дочки учатся в средней школе. Муж и сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации
У Курбонби есть коровник, где она ухаживает за животными. Курбонби семь лет своей жизни занимается выращиванием скота. Она занимается скота одна. Курбонби трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Ей этой деятельность нелегко заниматься, но Курбонби старается заниматься дальше. Потому, что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Для продолжения деятельностью она обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет купить крупнорогатого, малый рогатого скота и корм для скота. Запрашиваемый кредит очень важно для Курбонби. Она ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Kurbonbi is a resident of the Yavan region. She is married and has three children, two daughters and a son. Her daughters are high school students and her husband and son are working in Russia.

Kurbonbi has a cow shed where she cares for her animals. She has been raising livestock for seven years, a business she runs by herself. She works hard to earn money so she can care for her family. This occupation is not easy for her but she puts a lot of effort into it so she can earn enough money for her family's needs. In order to continue her business she is requesting a loan. She wants to buy large and small livestock and animal feed. This loan is very important to her and she awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy large and small livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an LCD screen and replace her old television because it is having technical problems.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 66, resident of Manila, Philippines. She’s married to Felix and they have children. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Myrna is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Myrna is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Myrna dreams to be a successful businesswoman. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business  and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice she needs to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonalyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino es un hombre muy emprendedor y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de platanos.
Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus 6 hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.
Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.
Catalino solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de surtido de platanos para vender.
Con tu ayuda Catalino Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Catalino is a very enterprising and tenacious man, who has big dreams that he is trying to complete.

He has a small business selling bananas.

With this work, he aims everyday day to go forward and to improve the conditions of life for his family, which includes his wife and his 6 children. They are the driving force for his life and his motivation to fight everyday. 

His biggest challenge is the competition in the area. With his ability, however, he is capable of sustaining himself and of progressing.

Catalino requests a loan to buy bananas to sell.

With your help, Catalino will be able to pay for his children education; this is one of his biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 55-year-old woman, who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of 2 children. Her husband runs a general store, and is  responsible for the needs of his entire family. 

Yasmeen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items, for his business. Due to financial constraints, he is not in a position to buy all of the above these products to resell. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities, and also help him to earn maximum income to manage his household and business.
 
Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Home System to replace candle consumption and have better lights at nights and increase hours of productivity

loans.name: Gagavale

texts.en:
Gagavale is a 49-year-old woman with seven children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Gagavale became a member of SPBD in 2014. She has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to help her run the business. Gagavale hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 47 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Rachel has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Analiza is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lucia has a buy-and-sell condiments business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garlic, and other items to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garlic, and other item to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Grace is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Grace has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos con edades de 14, 11 y 10 años, se dedica a realizar labores domésticas y a elaborar una venta de hot dogs y refrescos, actividad que realiza con el fin de tener ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares, el negocio aprendió a desarrollarlo dentro de su familia, por el momento no representa dificultades para trabajar.
Invertirá en la compra de un canopy, mesas y sillas, para tener buena imagen de su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, su objetivo es tener nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, que piensa utilizar para ir pagando las cuotas de su crédito y seguir aportando en los gastos familiares.
Claudia aspira a fortalecer más su negocio y ahorrar para que sus hijos tengan una educación superior de calidad.
texts.en: Claudia lives with her husband and three children ages 14, 11, and 10. She's employed as a housewife and selling hot dogs and beverages, an activity that she carries out for the purpose of earning income to help her husband with family expenses. She learned how to develop the business within her family and for the time being it hasn't been an obstacle to her work. She'll invest in the purchase of a canopy, tables, and chairs to give her business a good image and provide better service to her customers. Her objective is to get new customers, and increase her sales and income, which she's planning to use for loan payments and to continue helping with family expenses. Claudia aspires to strengthen her business and save up so that her kids can have a quality higher education.

loans.use: To purchase a canopy, tables and chairs to create a good image for her business and provide better service to the customers.

loans.name: Musarat Bibi

texts.en:
Musarat bibi is a responsible mother of one daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for twelve years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Musarat bibi's husband needs to make some repairs on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Musarat bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Musarat bibi's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport services to earn profitable income. Musarat bibi also plans to make some savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Musarat bibi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre muy amable y disciplinado, el solo esta unido de hecho con su esposa, tienen una hermosa familia de 6 hijos tres hombres y 3 mujeres de las edades de entre 1 y 15 años, todos están bajo la responsabilidad de su padre, vive en una comunidad de  Nahuala.
Diego un padre de familia admirable, que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia, se esfuerza día a día para poder darle a su familia lo necesario, el desde hace 17 años se dedica a la albañilería el construye casa, muros, y todo lo relacionado con construcción. Diego ahora ha tomado la decisión de comprar un terreno, pero lamentablemente con lo que Diego  gana no le alcanza, es por ello que el solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar un terreno donde cultivara café y banano.
Diego aspira a este prestamo para que pueda comprar su terreno y sacar de ello buenas cosechas para que algún día él pueda tener una farmacia y así mejor las condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Diego is a very kind and disciplined man. He is in a relationship and, together with his common-law wife, has a beautiful family with six children—three boys and three girls between the ages of 1 and 15. All his children are under his care. They live in a community in Nahuala.

Diego is a remarkable father, who cares about his family's needs. He strives every day to give his family everything they need.

He has been working as a bricklayer for 17 years. He builds houses, walls, and everything that has to do with construction.

Now, Diego has decided to purchase a plot of land, but, unfortunately, he doesn't make enough money to pay for it. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land, where he will grow coffee and bananas.

Diego is looking forward to receiving this loan to be able to purchase his plot of land and have a good harvest so that one day he can set up a pharmacy and, in this way, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a patient woman. She was born in 1982. She is living in a remote district. She is divorced and has two children. She has had a business for about three years. She is trading in kids’ wear.

She is planning to widen her activity. She wants to have additional income for making her standard of living better. She is planning to buy women’s clothes for sale. Malika needs financial support to buy a collection of women clothes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tienen 52 años de edad vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Marcos antes de realizar su primer prestamo él no contaba con varias herramientas de albañilería, pero gracias a su primer prestamo que realizo en ADICLA él pudo comprar todas las herramientas que le hacía falta para ejercer mejor su trabajo, Marcos afirma de que el confía en ADICLA por ser una asociación sólida y confiable que da los prestamos rápidos y fáciles, ahora marcos solicita un nuevo prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de terreno donde el podrá cultivar, pues hasta este momento él no cuenta con un terreno propio.
El sueño de Marcos es poder acceder a este prestamo para tener algún día en su propia casa la oficina de la constructora que el anhela tener.
texts.en: Marcos is 52 years old and lives in the community of San Pablo Jocopilas. Before receiving his first loan he didn't have several masonry tools, but thanks to the first loan that he received from ADICLA he was able to buy all of the tools he was lacking so he could do his job better. Marcos states that he trusts ADICLA because it's a solid and trustworthy association that provides loans quickly and easily. Now Marcos is applying for a loan that he'll use to purchase land that he'll be able to farm on, since he currently doesn't own his own land. Marcos' dream is to be able to have access to this loan so that one day he can have in his own home the office of the construction company he yearns to have.

loans.use: To purchase land.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

Paulina has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from fish vending and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome works hard to support her family. Salome is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines.

Salome requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Salome has been in this business for nine years now.

Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tolgonoi

texts.ru: Толгоной 43 года, замужем, 4 детей. Толгоной в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 4 года назад с суммы  4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Толгоной в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 0,25 Га собственной земли, где Толгоной выращивает картофель. Доход в месяц составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Толгоной обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока, покупки семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Толгоной планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Tolgonoi is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. To provide the primary income for her family, Tolgonoi is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 4 years ago with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tolgonoi's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows, 10 sheep and 0.25 hectares of owned land, where she grows potatoes. Her monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, Tolgonoi requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her milk sales, and to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. Tolgonoi plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities in order to save money for house repair.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her milk sales, and to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials such as gasoline, fishing net, etc.

Marcel has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Marcel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as gasoline, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, vive en una casa familiar en compañía de sus hijos, es soltera, por la necesidad de tener recursos económicos para ir cubriendo las necesidades familiares inicio a vender pupusas hace nueve años, de una de la tarde a siete de la noche, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, su hija le ayuda con el negocio y su mayor ventaja es que las demandas del producto en las zonas es muy buena.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar 3 mesas para mantener en buenas condiciones el equipo de trabajo, así mismo adquirirá aceite, quesillo, tomates, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas, con la compra su negocio mejorara el servicio a sus clientes y calidad de sus productos, no tiene riesgos de delincuencia en la zona y el local en que está ubicado el negocio es de su propiedad.
Sueña con tener más clientes satisfechos, ir dando mejor imagen a su negocio y lograr tener una mejor situación económica para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Andrea lives in the family home with her two children, is single, and because of the need for financial means to cover family expenses she started selling pupusas nine years ago, from 1 PM to 7 PM. She learned the job through her own efforts and her daughter helps her with the business. Her biggest advantage is that demand for the product in the area is very high. She'll use the loan to purchase 3 tables to keep the job equipment in good condition, and also acquire oil, cheese, tomatoes, etc to make pupusas for sale. With this purchase she'll improve the service to her customers and the quality of her products. There's no risk of crime in the area and the business is located on her property. She dreams of having more satisfied customers, improving her business' image and achieve a better financial situation to get her family ahead.

loans.use: To purchase 3 tables to keep the job equipment in good condition, and also acquire oil, cheese, tomatoes, etc, to make pupusas for sale.

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak is a 47-year-old widow with two children, who are living with her. They are living in a small village of Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. She has been a tailor for ten years, in order to support her family.

She has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for eight cycles now. The former loans allowed her children to go to school and for her family to have better living conditions.

Leading her group of five, she is applying for a loan of 1,700,000 KHR for sewing machines. She wishes to have a higher living standard.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Ty is an elderly married woman with four children. One of her children is living with her, and the rest are living with their own families. To earn a living, Ty has been farming rice for 20 years. It provides her with 5 USD of savings every day.

This is her thirteenth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a leader of her group, Ty is applying for a loan of 1,800,000 KHR for her rice farm. It will be used to hire a worker to plough the field and harvest the crops as well as to buy fertilizer. She believes that the rice farm will be more productive and earn her more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire a worker to plough her field and harvest her crops

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en:
Fifty-seven-year-old Sakun is a widow with three children. They are living in a small village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To earn an income, she has been planting rubber for 39 years. Her secondary source of income is from a cassava plantation.

Sakun has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles now. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 KHR for her rubber and cassava plantations. The loan will be used to buy tapping plates for the rubber plantation and fertilizer for both plantations. She expects that the cassava price will be increased; in return, it will provide her with a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy tapping plates for her rubber plantation and fertilizer for both of her plantations

loans.name: Nasiypa

texts.ru: Насийпа, 51 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей (3 дочери и 1 сын). Образование средне-специальное, в поиске дополнительных доходов для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и помощи и поддержки своего супруга и детей, Насийпа достигла хороших результатов в хозяйстве.  На сегодняшний день у Насийпы хорошее хозяйство: корова, 2 теленка, лошадь. На участке мерою 1,80 Га она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Насийпа обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Насийпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем хочет построить сарай с сеновалом и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Nasiypa is 51 years old, married and has 4 children (3 daughters and 1 son). She has a specialized secondary education and, to provide additional income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1996. Thanks to tireless work and help and support from her husband and children, Nasiypa achieved good business results. Today Nasiypa has a good farm, containing a cow, 2 calves and a horse. She also grows beans on 1.80 hectares of land. In order to further increase her livestock headcount, Nasiypa requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 20 sheep. Nasiypa plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and also wants to build a barn with a hayloft and repair her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 37-year-old mother with 11 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Ana has requested a loan to assist her in running her business. She will use the loan to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and plastic bags. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and plastic bags

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
Donata sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers are likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Donata also operates and maintains their house rental business. She dreams that her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en:
Met is a resident of a small village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. At age 37, Met is married with two children in school. Her main source of income is from planting cassava, which she has been doing for 19 years. She also does rice farming for extra income. Both plantations allow her to save around 7 USD a day.

Met is not new with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has successfully completed three cycles already. For her fourth cycle and leading her group of two, she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to hire workers to plough her field and also to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation. She wishes to expand her business and would like all of her children to continue to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava stems for her plantation and to hire workers to plough her field

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Living in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sokhoeun is a 52-year-old widow with three children who are living with her. One of her children is still in secondary education, while the others are already working. She has been a rice farmer for 32 years in order to support the family. She manages to earn around 7 USD per day.

This is her third cycle with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The previous loans enabled her to have proper clothing and better living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR for rice farming. Her loan will be used to buy potash and good quality rice seed. She believes that it will help improve the family's financial status.

loans.use: to buy potash and good quality rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is a 32-year-old mother. She operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Fuatino has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon to assist her with the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family’s daily needs. Fuatino joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, and a wooden spoon.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo signed up for his membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. Eduardo was able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days. 

He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he took a loan to restock his store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Sindangan - Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has a big interest in farming. Young as she is, she has cultivated their rice land in Sindangan and has gotten good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Grace knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Grace hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Felecisima

texts.en: Felecisima sells various agricultural commodities, like banana and root crops. She is a widow and has become a full-fledged member of PMPC.  She enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.  Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement for her house flooring. She is on her way to flooring her house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement for her house flooring

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is managing her eatery business in Dapaon. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
Bety started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales, since she is the only store in their barangay. 

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes provide a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl had the skills and expertise in "yema" (custard candy) making, yet she had no capital to make it for business. As a mother from Oroquieta, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she, and helping her husband earn an income. 

Liezl joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a business, which is "yema" making. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her product. Liezl has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients and egg incubator for her business. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family. Today, other retail businesses sell her product, which in turn helps them earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients and egg incubator for her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 44 years old and has five children. Carolina is married and has two children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Carolina has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.   In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelica is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Angelica has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meats, spices, etc. for her food business.  Angelica has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meats, spices, etc. for her food business

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio is a widower.  He makes a good earning on his farm in Oroquieta. This is the primary means of his income, supporting his needs. He wants to increase his farm yield.  Dionesio approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase fertilizer and compost for his fruit bearing trees on his farm. He has high hopes that he will have good produce next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for his fruit bearing trees on his farm

loans.name: Kanwal Shehzadi

texts.en:
Kanwal Shehzadi is a 35-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 11 years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Kanwal Shehzadi's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories like pieces of clothes, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable condition to buy the above-mentioned items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Kanwal Shehzadi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

Kanwal Shehzadi is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to enable her husband to buy tailoring accessories that he needs for his business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Charito is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy materials needed like nail cutters, etc. for her manicure and pedicure business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed, like nail cutters, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds for her growing hogs. Aside from her project of building additional concrete pig pens, she has been thinking of adding more pigs for swine production. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds for her growing hogs

location.town: Plaridel - Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is 55 years old with 7 children. She operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Fetu has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan, wooden spoons, plastic bags and containers to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

Fetu joined SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a frying pan, wooden spoona, plastic bags and containers.

loans.name: Shamiguli

texts.ru: Шамигули молодая жительница города Куляб. Ей всего 23 лет. Она замужем и пока не имеет детей. Ее муж находится за границей, он зарабатывает и помогает жене с финансовыми трудностями. Шамигули занимается продажей фруктов уже год. Она на местном рынке продает фрукты. Ее научила мама работать в торговой сфере. У нее уже имеется свои постоянные клиенты. Шамигули хочет купить больше фруктов, чтобы расширить бизнес. Для купли фруктов у нее не хватает денежных средств, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Пожалуйста, поддержите Шамигули. Она очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Shamiguli is a young resident of the city of Kulob. She is all of 23 years old, married, and does not have children yet. Her husband works abroad, earning money and helping his wife with financial difficulties. Shamiguli has been selling fruit for a year already. She sells fruit at the local market. She learned the retail business from her mother and already has repeat customers. Shamiguli wants to buy more fruit and expand her business. She does not have enough money to buy fruit so she applied for a loan. Please help Shamiguli. She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is a businesswoman from Jose Dalman, Tabon. She is 35 years old, a widow, and has expertise in selling. She runs a sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Maryjane is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Maryjane continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Letania

texts.en:
Letania makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Tubod, Aloran, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. She and her husband have been able to provide for their family doing this type of work.

Now she wishes to plant a good variety of banana on the coconut farm and dwarf coconuts for additional farm yields. However, Letania is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to make holes for and plant banana and dwarf coconut seedlings.

Letania has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to make holes for and plant banana and dwarf coconut seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalve

texts.en:
Rosalve is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Rosalve has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 8 years. Rosalve would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru: Parviz is a handsome guy. He was born in 1993. He is living in remote district. He is single. He is a student. Parviz is an active, patience, kind and honest person. It is fourth year of his education now. His major is energy manager. He hopes he will be a high qualified energy manager after graduation. He is studying well and active, gets automatically his marks at exams. He is well known among students and friends. At free time he is busy with working as electrician and serving people. The money that he earns is spends in everyday needs and expenditures. He tries to help to his parents and do not be a burden for them. He likes to read books and learn foreign languages. He is needed to pay tuition of university for education. Parviz is requested financial support from KIVA project 850$ loan to pay tuition.
texts.en:
Parviz is a handsome guy. He was born in 1993. He is living in a remote district. He is single and is a student. Parviz is an active, patient, kind and honest person. 

It is the fourth year of his education now. His major is energy manager. He hopes he will be a highly qualified energy manager after graduation. He is studying well and is active, and automatically gets his marks at exams. He is well known among students and friends. 

In his free time, he is busy with working as an electrician and serving people. The money that he earns is spent on everyday needs and expenditures. He tries to help his parents and not be a burden for them. He likes to read books and learn foreign languages. 

He needs to pay tuition to the university for education. Parviz is requesting financial support from the Kiva project, an $850 loan to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Peter Sr.

texts.en:
Peter Sr. makes good earnings on his rice farm, which he manages in Oroquieta. This is how he supports his family and is able to send all his children to school.

Peter Sr. wants to increase his farm yield especially since he has a high cost of living since his children entered college. Peter Sr. approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and fertilizer.

He has high hopes that he will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and fertilizer.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is a hardworking father from Oqoquieta. He is married. He is a businessman who makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). He buys whole coconuts for this. 

Leoncio has signed his membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. He applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Leoncio hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 47 years old and lives in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with 3 school age children. She earns through selling clothes and has had this business for 5 years.

Rosemary has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She requested a loan to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

In the future, Rosemary hopes to be more successful doing her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is 32 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Clarisa works very hard to provide for them.

Clarisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

Clarisa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, milk, juices, sachet, sugar, candies, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Clarisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anita Bibi

texts.en:
Anita Bibi is a 25 year-old-woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past several days, her husband's rickshaw has not been working properly and because of that, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Anita Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 58 years old and married with three children. Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell at her store, like canned goods, beverages, school supplies and groceries.

Edita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, sandwich spreads, cups of noodles, candles, shampoo, soap, coffee, milk and other groceries. 

In the future, Edita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like canned goods, beverages, school supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 59 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Flordeliza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Flordeliza has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Flordeliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 63 years old and married with six children. Magdalina works very hard to provide for them.

Magdalina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, bread, etc.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, bread etc.

loans.name: Leofi

texts.en:
Leofi is 25 years old, and she operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this business for more than a year. 

Leofi has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and frying pan to assist her in the business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. Leofi joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and frying pan.

loans.name: Christmas

texts.en:
Christmas is a 40-year-old mother with four children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant and cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this business for more than two years. 

Christmas has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her with running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profits in the near future. Christmas became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Morrasikini

texts.en:
Morrasikini, a 24-year-old mother of three, operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Morrasikini has requested this loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan for her business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. Morrasikini joined SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 42 years old and married with three children.

Gladys works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell at her store, like condiments, eggs, cigarettes and groceries.

Gladys has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from fishing.

Gladys aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like condiments, eggs, cigarettes and groceries.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and has five children. Imelda is married and two of her children are still in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Imelda has been in business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 56 years old and married with four children. Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell at her store, like canned goods, eggs, condiments and groceries.

Lucila has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, sotangjon, junk food, etc.

In the future, Lucila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell at her store, like canned goods, eggs, condiments and groceries.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel, a 39-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. For three years she has operated a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as biscuits, shampoo, banansa, candies, sugar, bread, junk foods and other groceries. 

Mabel has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, bread, biscuits, condiments, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, bread, biscuits, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Melgene

texts.en:
Melgene, a 27-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. For two years she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Having repaid her previous loan, Mabel has requested a new one from NWTF for PHP 8000 to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap, sugar, etc.

Melgene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita, who is married, works hard to support her family. For eight years she has operated a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Josita has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials and tools for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a 60-year-old married mother of five, works very hard to provide for her family. For six years she has operated a general store in the Philippines. 

Erlinda has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Valevale

texts.en:
Valevale is a 25-year-old woman with two children. She owns and operates a small business, selling elei printing materials (traditional decorative items) at the market to earn a living. 

Valevale has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs and containers to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this business for more than five years. She hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. 

Valevale became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs and containers.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 22-year-old mother with three children. She operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. 

Pauline has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profits. 

Pauline joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, frying pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags and yeast for her business.

loans.name: Bisharifa

texts.en:
Bisharifa is a hardworking woman. She lives in a small town. She is married and has one child. 

She had a dream to educate her child. Her son’s name is Rustamjon. Rustamjon is studying at a medical university in Novosibirsk. He is a third year student. His major is doctor. He is active in classes and gets excellence and good marks. He lives in a dormitory. 

Bisharifa's son wants to be a qualified doctor and be useful for the benefit of society. Bisharifa and her husband are having some difficulties with paying their son's tuition. Bisharifa has requested financial support from Kiva lenders to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.en:
Ranojon is a businesswoman. She was born in 1971, and she lives in a small town. She is married and has four children. Her husband repairs cars. 

Ranojon is a responsible, hardworking and kind person. Now she is opening a grocery store. She is making renovations to the second floor of her house. Her business is new. Separately, she works at a medical college as a charwoman (cleaning worker). 

Ranojon is asking for financial support to buy equipment (storefront, refrigerator) and grocery products to sell at her store.

loans.use: to buy equipment (storefront, refrigerator) and grocery products.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 38 years old and has five children. She is married four of her children are still in school.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business of farming in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Jonalyn has been in business for eight years now, and has borrowed loans four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 42 years old and has two children. She is married, and has one child who is currently in school.

Marivic has an agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Marivic requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivic has been in the business of pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed loans seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marivic would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Toton

texts.ru: Тотон 60 лет, замужем. Имеет 5 детей. У Тотон средне-специальное образование, она на пенсии, однако продолжает работать учителем в школе. Имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей и коллег. Они отзываются о ней как о спокойной и трудолюбивой женщине. Тотон в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 60,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тотон, она смогла развить и расширить свою деятельность, получая прибыль примерно 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 9 коров, 4 овцы. На участке, мерою 3,50 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тотон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец и удобрений для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Тотон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Toton is 60, married, and has five children. She has a secondary vocational education and is retired, though she continues to teach at the school. Her colleagues and neighbors speak highly of her and describe her as a quiet and hardworking woman. Toton earns additional income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she has done since 1995 when she started a business with 60,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to develop her business and currently earns around 30,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, Toton applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 20 goats and fertilizers for crops. She plans to use the profits to expand her business and make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Ma. Loida

texts.en:
Ma. Loida is 51 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Ma. Loida works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Loida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like candies, shampoo, canned goods and groceries.

Ma. Loida has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as beverages, junk food, candies, straw, noodles, biscuits, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Loida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like candies, shampoo, canned goods and groceries.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Divina is 60 years old. Two of her children are still in school.

Divina has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

Divina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ivis Patricia

texts.es:
Ivis es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años y una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es el transporte de pasajeros interdepartamental.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, generosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la urbanización ‘Mariscal Santa Cruz’ un área caracterizada por su reciente creación, se encuentra a 22 km de la ciudad y está conectada a la misma por una carretera asfaltada y una línea de tren que se encuentra de nuevo en funcionamiento desde finales de 2008, ubicada en el Altiplano y posee un clima frío y seco la mayor parte del año con una estación lluviosa entre diciembre y febrero.
Ivis es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de edredones y colchas para dormitorio, su segunda actividad es la elaboración de instrumentos musicales. Recientemente adquirió un vehículo de transporte para 16 pasajeros, el cual piensa utilizarlo como transporte público interdepartamental. “la necesidad de tener otro ingreso económico me llevo a comprar este vehículo, el cual ayudará a mi familia en el pago de los gastos y mejorará mi calidad de vida…” comenta. Su sueño es construir su casa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de una parrilla para el techo de su movilidad para llevar el equipaje de los pasajeros. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que realiza diferentes actividades económicas. 
Es por esos motivos que Ivis solicita un préstamo para la compra de una parrilla para el techo de su movilidad para transportar el equipaje de los futuros viajantes.
texts.en:
Ivis is a 28-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 6-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter. Her business is providing inter-departmental transportation to passengers.

She is a good mother and is enterprising, kind, generous, responsible, and hard working. She pursues her business in the urban area called “Mariscal Santa Cruz,” which is in an area characterized by its recent growth. It is located 22 km from the city and is connected to the city by an asphalt highway and by a train line that is newly functional since the end of 2008. It is located in the Altiplano (the Bolician Plateau), and it has a cold and dry climate for most of the year, with a rainy season between December and February. 

Ivis has brown skin, long black hair that she wears tied up, and short stature. Her mother tongue is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish for general life and for her work. She shares her life with her partners, who works in business, and with her children who study in school. They live in a rented house, which is built from bricks with a corrugated iron roof; the house has drinking water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her business is making quilts and bedspreads for the bedroom. Her secondary activity is making musical instruments. Recently, she acquired a transportation vehicle for 16 passengers, which she plans to use for inter-departmental public transportation. She says that the need to have another source of income drove her to buy this vehicle; this will help her family in paying the expenses and will improve their quality of life.
