Her dream is building her own house. She wants to buy a roof rack for the roof of her car to accommodate her passengers’ luggage. This is her second sequence of loans with the institution in her 16 years of pursuing different works. 

It is for these reasons that Ivis requests a loan to buy a roof rack for the roof of her vehicle to transport the luggage of her future passengers.

loans.use: to buy a roof rack for the roof of her vehicle to transport the luggage of her future passengers.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Liezl works hard to support her family.

She has a rice mill business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. 

Liezl is borrowing 8,500 PHP through NWTF to pay for rice grains and laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

Liezl has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and laborers' salaries at her rice mill.

loans.name: Ma. Sylvia

texts.en:
Ma. Sylvia is 39 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ma. Sylvia works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Sylvia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell at her store, like beverages, canned goods, condiments, eggs and groceries.

Ma. Sylvia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canton, beverages, shampoo, junk food, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Ma. Sylvia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell at her store, like beverages, canned goods, condiments, eggs and groceries.

loans.name: Denalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Denalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Denalinda is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell at her business.

Denalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 39 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, bread, biscuits, groceries, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items including shampoo, soft drinks, milk, coffee, junk foods, candies, etc. 

In the future, Nora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, bread, biscuits, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and a variety of dairy products to supply his business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ruby has been in this business for 17 years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional eggs, crackers, bottled water, etc. to sell.

Ruby would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs, crackers, bottled water, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Las ganas de salir adelante de Gloria le dan vida a su negocio de ropa usada y su pequeña pulpería. Esto le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas, aportar a la economía familiar y desarrollarse como microempresaria. 
 
Es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para la compra de telas, porque también es costurera, y necesita estos materiales para cumplir con sus pedidos, pues ahora tiene la capacidad de confeccionar más ropa, porque su hermana la ayuda en esta labor. Esta mujer luchadora se esfuerza día a día para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria’s desire to go forward gives life to her used clothing business and her small store. This has helped her grow her sales, support her family’s finances, and develop as a micro-entrepreneur. 

It is for this reason that she requests a loan to buy fabric because she is also a seamstress. She needs these materials to complete her orders, since she now has the capacity to make more clothing because her sister helps her in this work. This hard-working woman makes an effort day after day to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business, which is the only source of support for her children, who are looking for the way to get ahead in their studies.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 31, lives in a small community of Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is the farther of one little child. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his product to local dealers. 

So far, he is has been in this type of business for fifteen years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. 

Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
This is Elenita, 55, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, a retired policeman, and the mother of their two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elenita operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, along with spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elenita dreams that her business will continue to support their needs and help her save for the future of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for new units and buy spare parts and accessories needed in her internet cafe.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Her hog-raising business in Oroquieta, the Philippines, has enabled Erlinda to make a living to support her husband to benefit their family. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to be able to avail credit for her enterprise. 

Erlinda takes care of her business just as she does with her PMPC membership, knowing that as long as she remains in good standing with the organization, she can rely on it for any financing needs. She has requested this loan of Php 10,000  to help her build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 41 years old and has seven children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 25 years. 

Emma requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns more income from buying and selling rice grains.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, beers, biscuits, etc.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Roselyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, beers, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Catarina Armida

texts.es:
Catarina, se encuentra soltera, vive con su hija, su negocio consiste en ofertar productos de la canasta básica como aceite, granos básicos, cereales, etc., el negocio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, atiende a sus clientes de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m., Catarina realizo la apertura de su negocio hace ya seis años.
Comprará especias, detergentes, azúcar, sal, pan, huevos, etc., incrementara su inventario para tener oportunidad de mejores ventas y ganancias, se mantendrá trabajando para ir cambiando el estilo de vida familiar.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más amplio que cubra las necesidades de los clientes de su comunidad y le de ingresos importantes para reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Catarina is single and lives with her daughter. She sells basic items such as oil, basic grains, cereal, etc. She learned this business from her family and opened her own business six years ago. She tends to her customers from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.. 

She will use the money to buy spices, detergents, sugar, salt, bread, eggs, etc. and will increase her inventory to  improve sales and increase her earnings. She will continue to work so she can continue to improve her family's life style. 

Her dreams are to expand her business to meet the needs of the customers in her community and to provide her with the significant revenue she needs to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy spices, detergents, sugar, salt, bread, eggs, etc. to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, por la facilidad de pago y apoyo que recibe de la institución se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar baterías, rayos, aceite, parches y otros repuestos para reparar y dar mantenimiento a motocicletas.
El capital que anteriormente se le presto le sirvió para equipar debidamente su negocio, los clientes están recibiendo un buen servicio y don Carlos obtiene mejores utilidades de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos' last experience applying for a loan was positive; the lender provided support and made the process smooth. He's therefore decided to apply for a new loan for the purchase of batteries, spokes, oil, patches, and other spare parts for the repair and maintenance of motorcycles. 
  
The funds that Carlos received from the last loan allowed him to stock his business. He's therefore able to provide excellent service, and is getting more benefit from running the business.

loans.use: to purchase batteries, spokes, motor oil, patches, and other spare parts for motorcycle repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Salome Santos

texts.es:
Salome, posee una tienda de artículos varios y una pequeña venta de medicinas, es soltero,vive con sus padres y hermanos, el negocio lo heredo de sus padres y posteriormente ha ido incluyendo nuevos productos para competir mejor en el mercado.
El crédito será de ayuda para comprar nuevos medicamentos, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, agua, dulces, boquitas, etc., surtirá mejor el negocio para aprovechar el mes de Febrero, así generar nuevas ventas y mayores ingresos para mejorar la vivienda, incrementar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes y resarcir su deuda.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio estable para tener un patrimonio con el que apoyara a su familia y será independiente.
texts.en:
Salome has a store where he sells varied items as well as a small business selling medicine. He is single and lives with his parents and his siblings. He inherited the business from his parents and later included new products to better compete in the market.

The loan will help to buy new medications, basic grains, juices, sodas, water, candies, snacks, etc. This will better stock the business to take advantage of the month of February. This way, he will generate new sales and more income to improve his home, increase the merchandise he offers to his customers and to pay for his loan.

His dream is to keep his business stable to have assets to support his family and become independent.

loans.use: to buy new medications, basic grains, juices, sodas, water, candies, snacks,  etc. This will better stock his business to take advantage of the month of February.

loans.name: Abdulhafiz

texts.en:
Abdulhafiz has received the first loan from Kiva lenders to buy some construction supplies to use for renovating his old house. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan which helped him very much in making some of the necessary renovations on his house. 

He hasn't yet completely repaid the first loan, but has applied for a concurrent loan of 500,000 YER in order to purchase another amount of construction materials to complete all the renovations on his house. 

With the first loan he renovated a small part of the house, and now he wants to complete the rest. Abdulhafiz hopes this loan will be funded, too.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house.

loans.name: Belkis Carolina

texts.es:
Mantener el negocio surtido es una de las principales metas de Belkis, las ventas han aumentado gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Ella ha logrado comprar más productos plásticos que le dieron variedad a su negocio, y de esta forma pudo atraer a más clientela, aportar a la economía de su hogar y adquirir nuevos productos. 

Belkis solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su tienda y comprar: baldes, termos, platos, vasos, escobas, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá continuar con  el ritmo de ventas actual. Ella lucha por ser una mujer autosostenible y a largo plazo lograr que su negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Keeping her business stocked is one of Belkis' main goals. Sales have increased thanks to her hard work and dedication. She has been able to buy some plastic products that brought variety to her business. That is how she was able to attract more customers, contribute to the family budget, and acquire new products.  

Belkis is asking for the loan to invest in her store and buy buckets, thermoses, plates, cups, brooms, etc. This will help her because she will be able to continue with the current sales rhythm. She is fighting to be a self supporting woman and in the long run be bale to make her business become a distribution center.

loans.use: to buy buckets, thermoses, plates, cups, brooms, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is driven by a passion for selling. She is 39 years old and separated with three school-age children. 

Imelda runs a store that primarily supports their needs. Everyday day, she tirelessly tends her store. Imelda is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has taken out several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without default. Now, she has borrowed once again to pay for assorted inventory to sell. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her children.

loans.use: to pay for assorted store inventory to sell.

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en: Jerilyn is 39 years old and married with three children. The family lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer who has cultivated rice for their consumption and also owns a small coconut farming operation to support their needs. Jerilyn wants to earn income to benefit her family so she joined PMPC after hearing she can obtain financial assistance. She applied for a loan start a retail business. The loan is intended to purchase dried fish to sell. Jerilyn deeply wishes that her business will grow to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish fo sell

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Juliebeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Juliebeth is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Juliebeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Lucilla is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pig fattening business.

Lucilla has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old and married with two children.  

Alma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming vegetables for 11 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adelaida is 41 years old now.

Adelaida has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for one year.

Adelaida requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana vending business in the Philippines. 

Catalina has been in this business for 18 years, and she earns more income from rug-making.

Catalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her banana vending business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is from the town of Kisauni. She’s a very hard-working person who has always worked to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a cafe in downtown Kisauni. She’s had the business for more than six years and it has attained a good reputation in the neighborhood with a good clientele. She describes herself as a person who always strives to attain what she wants. Agnes is asking for this loan to purchase tables, table mats, chairs and other items for her cafe to benefit her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity knowing that it will help her very much.

loans.use: to purchase tables, table mats, chairs and other items for her cafe.

loans.name: Lucia Del Transito

texts.es:
Lucía, vive con una hija y un nieto, actualmente es soltera, es dueña de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y es empleada como maestra en un centro escolar cercano a su vivienda, el negocio lo abre todos los días con apoyo de su hija.
Comprará cereales, arroz, frijoles, pan, huevos, jabón, etc., y chancletas, estos productos fortalecerán su negocio para que sus clientes puedan adquirir lo que necesiten, espera ir generando nuevos ingresos para cubrir todos los gastos familiares.
Su propósito es administrar bien el crédito y tener en el mercado su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucía lives with a daughter and a grandson. Right now she is single. She owns a store where she sells staple products and she works as a teacher at a school close to her home. She opens the store every day with her daughter's help. 

She will buy cereals, rice, beans, bread, eggs, soap, etc., as well as flip-flops. These products will fortify her business so that her customers can acquire what they need. She hopes to earn more income to cover the family expenses. 

Her goal is to manage the loan well and have a source of income in the market.

loans.use: to buy cereals, rice, beans, bread, eggs, soap, etc. as well as flip-flops. These products will fortify her business.

loans.name: Sidwata 09 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUDOUGOU représente le groupe SIDWATA 09 SAPONE. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 07personnes en charge.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 20ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter 05 porcs.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité et construire. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. KOUDOUGOU represents the group SIDWATA 09 SAPONE. He is married with 5 children aged 5 to 17, four of them in school. He supports 7 people. 

Koudougou has been a breeder for 20 years. He buys the animals in his district. He wants to buy 5 pigs. 

He plans to reinvest his profits in his activity. His goal is to support his children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin is a 28-year-old single man. His mother was his father’s second wife, so he also has a half-sister who shares the same mother with him. His father died of heart attack last year, so he and his mother had to stick together and support each other. 

In order to cure his father’s illness, this family had to sell their house and use all of their savings. Bin had never been in a relationship with one girl because of his father’s years of sickness, and no girls wanted to fall in love with him.
 
Bin has been engaged in appliance repair for many years and he started his own business last year. He requested 10,000 CNY from MicroCred. He will use the money to purchase a number of household appliances, so that his business survives.

Although there are lots of disappointments in his life, he still believes that he will have a bright future and he will find his own happiness.

loans.use: to purchase a number of household appliances

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 43, is residing in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has three children. 

To make a living and support her family, Channy opened a store to sell vegetables in the market, which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than ten years. On average, Channy is able to make an income of $5 (USD) a day. 

Currently, Channy would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. 

Channy would like to thank all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make juice drinks

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 59 years old, a widow, and has a snack-vending business in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. Recently, Angelita took out a loan to pay for bags of cement, "amakan" (bamboo mats), and loads of sand and gravel for her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative. Angelita is now on her way to rebuilding her house.

loans.use: to pay for bags of cement, "amakan" (bamboo mats), and loads of sand and gravel for her house

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 63 years old and married with two children.

Mely works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mely has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mely aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ellen requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business.

Ellen has been in this business for seven years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ellen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anyelo Gabriel

texts.es:
Anyelo, es un joven soltero, vive en casa de su madre, trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. brindando sus servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras, decoraciones para eventos sociales, y también posee una tiende de productos varios, dentro de su familia aprendió el oficio, ya cuenta con su propio negocio y ha diversificado sus productos, para Anyelo su negocio es la manera de tener una fuente de ingresos propia para ser independiente y ayudar a su madre.
Comprará diferentes repuestos para computadoras, peluches, flores, papelería, tarjetas, etc., para que sus clientes encuentren lo necesario para celebrar las festividades de san Valentín y queden satisfechos con sus servicios, pretende tener nuevos ingresos para adquirir experiencia con el manejo de créditos, su ventaja es que sus productos no son perecederos y los puede comercializar todo el año.
Anyelo sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes y seguir siendo un apoyo económico para su familia.
texts.en:
Anyelo is a single young man who lives at his mother’s house. He works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Anyelo provides computer repair and maintenance services, as well as decorations for social events. He also has a store where he sells various products. Anyelo learned this trade from his family and then started his own business. He has diversified the products within his business so that he can have his own source of income, which allows him to be independent and capable of helping his mother.

Anyelo will buy various computer parts, plush toys, flowers, stationery, cards, and other products that his customers need in order to celebrate the Valentine’s Day festivities so that they remain satisfied with his services. He expects that having a new source of income will allow him to acquire experience with managing loans. The advantage of his business is that his products are not perishable, so they can be sold throughout the year.

Anyelo dreams of growing his business, improving the merchandise that he offers his customers, and continuing his ability to support his family financially.

loans.use: to buy various computer parts, plush toys, flowers, stationery, cards, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Jheovana

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 2 años y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comunicadora, feliz, alegre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona central,  un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 12-22 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, complexión física robusta, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua el cual habla en familia, y habla español para el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pequeña hija que la acompaña en el trabajo y se dedica a jugar casi todo el día, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster; ella compra pollo, lo troza y le pone sal, luego lo coce, lo sazona y lo pone a freír, para servirlo con papas fritas y arroz. La venta la realiza al medio día y por la noche de lunes a domingo, el resto del tiempo se encarga de la compra de insumos de cocina como pollo, aceite, especias, etc., y del cuidado de su hija. “la gente come todo el tiempo y el pollo les gusta a la mayoría, es por eso que me decidí a iniciar mi negocio y con la fuerza que me da mi hija me va muy bien…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante más grande. Él desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; pollo, aceite, harina, especias y otros, para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para la elaboración y venta de pollos a la broaster para darle un futuro mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, single, and has a two-year-old daughter. Her business is selling broaster chickens. She is a good mother who is enterprising, communicative, content, happy, responsible and hard-working. 

Maria's business is located in the central zone which is a commercial area where universities, public offices, and private businesses are intermingled. The climate is cold and dry with temperatures ranging between 12 and 22 Celsius (54-72 F), varying during the daytime. Maria has a dark complexion, long black hair which she ties back, dark eyes, and is short and stout. Her mother tongue is Quechua which they speak at home, but she uses Spanish for business. She shares her life with her little girl who goes with her to work and plays almost all day long. They live in a rented room that has running drinking water, electricity and a sewer system.

To make her broaster chickens, Maria buys chicken, cuts it into pieces, salts it, cooks it, seasons it and then fries it. She serves it with french fries and rice. She sells at mid-day and at night, from Monday to Sunday. At other times she takes care of her daughter and buys her cooking supplies such as chicken, oil, spices, etc. "People eat all the time and most everyone likes chicken. That is why I decided to start my business. And with the inspiration my daughter gives me, it is going very well" she states. 

Her dream is to have a larger restaurant. She wants to invest in her business by buying cooking supplies such as chicken, oil, flour, spices, etc. so she will have a stable supply of ingredients. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been running her business. These are the reasons that Maria is applying for a loan - to buy cooking supplies for making and selling broaster chicken so she can provide a better future for her little girl.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies for making and selling broaster chickens.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Sherlita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, fish, flour, and spices.

Sherlita has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, fish, flour, and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his farm products to market.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio de ganado y también tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene dos hijos.

Vilma, se dedica al comercio de ganado desde hace 15 años, este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, actualmente solo tienen dos vacas.

Vilma, necesita el crédito para comprar dos vacas, porque las que vacas que tienen, están paridas y asi no las pueden vender, con la ayuda del crédito podrán continuar con el negocio y quieren aprovechar el precio que les dan por las dos vacas.

Vilma, sueña con tener una ganadería tecnificada y comercializar con el ganado y sus derivados, para incrementar el ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and studied through the sixth grade. She is married and her husband works in the cattle trade. He also operates a metal shop. They have two children.

Vilma has been in the livestock trade for 15 years. She learned the business from her husband. They currently have two cows. Vilma needs a loan in order to buy two more cows because the ones they have just gave birth and cannot be sold. With the help of this loan, she can continue her business and also take advantage of the price for the two cows being offered.

Vilma dreams of having a modernized livestock business where she can sell cattle and their related products. She also wants to increase her dairy herd.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, es propietaria de un salón de belleza, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, solo ella cuida de sus hijos, su jornada de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, el negocio lo inicio por cuenta propia y con ayuda de folletos, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, su único riesgo es el alto nivel de competencia que existe alrededor de su local.
Planea comprar tintes, cosméticos, lociones y accesorios, surtirá su inventario con nuevos productos para atraer más clientes y satisfacer sus  demandas, su objetivo es mejorar su situación financiera y costear todos los gastos de su familia.
La aspiración de Rosa es tener un negocio más grande y contratar personal para que le ayude a atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is the owner of a beauty salon. She has two children, ages 14 and 10, and is the one who is taking care of them. Her work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. She started her business on her own with the help of brochures. Rosa has 10 years of experience. Her only business risk is the high level of competition that exists in her town.

Rosa plans to buy dyes, cosmetics, lotions, and accessories so that she can restock her inventory with new products. This will help her to attract more customers and satisfy the demand. Her goal is to improve her financial situation and cover all of her family’s expenses.

Rosa aspires to having a larger business where she can hire employees to help with attending to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dyes, cosmetics, lotions, and accessories so that she can restock her inventory with new products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: David Omar

texts.es:
David, opta por otro crédito para continuar con su negocio, en esta oportunidad comprara consolas y video juegos para revender a un mejor precio.
Con el préstamo anterior David ha mantenido el negocio surtido, cuenta con nuevos clientes, sus hijos le apoyan en el negocio y la vida que hoy en día brinda a su familia es más confortable.
texts.en: David is requesting another loan to continue his business.  He will use this loan to purchase consoles and video games that he will resell at a higher price.  With his previous loan, David was able to keep his business stocked and attract new customers.  His children help him out with his business, and he is now able to provide his family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: purchase consoles and video games to resell at a higher price.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 64 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Denia is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Denia has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase clothing and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Olga Yamila

texts.es:
Olga, tiene como actividad económica la venta de ropa y útiles escolares, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, es casada, sus hijos aún son dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo, ya cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, su jornada de trabajo inicia a las seis de la mañana y finaliza a las seis y media de la tarde, hasta la fecha no presenta dificultades.
Invertirá en camisas, pantalones, faldas, calcetines, chores y otras prendas de vestir, ofrecerá un inventario más completo a sus clientes para que sus ventas aumenten y le generen mayores ganancias, su riesgo es estar expuesta a un asalto.
Los sueños que Olga desea realizar son darle a sus hijos apoyo para que se superen académicamente y que vivan en un techo digno.
texts.en:
Olga sells clothing and school supplies. She lives with her husband and children. The children are still young and count on her and her husband for financial support.  She already has experience in this business and she works from 6am until 6:30pm. To this day, she has not encountered any difficulties.  

She will invest in shirts, pants, skirts, socks, shorts and other clothing articles. She will offer a more complete inventory to her customers in order to increase the sales and generate more profit. Being robbed is a risk she is exposed to.

Olga’s dream is to support her children academically and to provide them with a decent shelter to live in.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, pants, skirts, socks, shorts and other clothing articles to offer a more complete inventory to her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion De Compone Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila ella es casada y tiene 40 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganadería , la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres en Accion de Compone.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Mujeres En Accion De Compone” (Composed of Active Women) communal bank.  The communal bank is located in Anta District, which is a part of Anta Province and Cusco Department.

Sra. Lucila is one of the communal bank members.  She is married, 40-years old and has five children.  She has a livestock business.  She raises and fattens cattle to later sell at various markets.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Sra. Lucila hopes to get ahead through her work.  She wants to expand her cattle-sales business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase more livestock. 

This loan is a part of one of Asociación Arariwa's Credi Yapa lines of credit.  This line of credit is awarded to borrowers with good credit history.  This is a group of people who possess just such characteristics. 

The communal bank members in the inset photo had their picture taken after the meeting.  They had requested permission to miss the meeting for reasons relating to their work. 

The person whose face is covered with a white circle is no longer a member of the "Mujeres en Accion de Compone" communal bank.

The other communal bank members make their livings in agriculture, selling animals, running grocery stores and running a restaurant. 

Sra. Lucila is grateful to those who are forming a part of her dream by granting the loan, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Maria Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado en la escuela de su cantón, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la albañilería y agricultura, tiene dos hijos.

Florentina, se dedica a los oficios domesticos, pero en tiempos de producción agrícola colabora con actividades del campo, para reducir el costo por mano de obra.
 
Los ingreso que recibe su familia son pocos, junto a su pareja han colocado una pequeña tienda de productos lácteos en su cantón, ya que han visto una oportunidad de negocio que pueden desarrollar poco a poco.

Florentina, necesita el crédito para comprar productos lácteos como: queso, crema, cuajada y leche, para vender.

Florentina, siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda más grande, que genere más ingresos, con ello pretenden mejorar su calidad de vida.- También, desea que sus hijos estudien hasta logran un grado académico superior.
texts.en:
Florentina is 34 years old and has a second grade education.  She is married and her spouse works as a mason and a farmer. She has two children.  Florentina is a homemaker but during the harvest season, she helps her husband in the field in order to reduce their labor costs.  Her family's income is very little so together with her husband she has opened a small dairy goods store in their town, having seen an opening for a business that they can develop over time.

Florentina is in need of a loan to purchase dairy products such as cheese, cream, curds and milk.  Florentina has always dreamed of having a larger store that generates more income.  With this loan she hopes to improve her quality of life.  She also hopes for her children to attend school and reach a high academic level.

loans.use: purchase dairy products such as cheese, cream, curds and milk.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esmeralda is 50 years old.

Esmeralda has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making rugs

loans.name: Abaduzamugambi Group

texts.fr:
Estella fait partie du groupe   Abaduzamigambi et  habite à  Muramvya. Elle a 41 ans et est mariée à Nestor, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 1 à 15 ans, dont  4 étudient.
 
Elle fait le commerce de chaussures  depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Estella is part of the group Abaduzamigambi and lives in Muramvya. She is 41 years old and married to Nestor, a merchant. Together, they have six children, aged 1 to 15, of whom four are students. 

Estella has been doing commerce in shoes for fifteen years. 

She is on her 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and to purchase many shoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.use: to purchase shoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has been managing her burger house for a number of years already. She buys buns, burgers and hot dogs from a wholesaler and cooks and sells them as snacks from her stand. This type of burger stand is popular among Filipinos; it is a lot cheaper than the internationally known burgers and is also more flavorful. It's a favorite snacks of students and the working class as well. Erlinda serves the local working community and a nearby school. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine pesos (PHP) net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Elvira is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy buns, oil, hot dogs, hamburgers and gas needed for her burger stand. She believes that with this financial assistance her sales and earnings will increase. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment. Your financial help will surely help ensure their daily sustenance.

Erlinda hopes to sustain her business and attract more customers for her burger stand. All she wants is good health for her family and to lead a godly life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for buns, burgers and hot dogs to sell at her burger stand.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum, 54, lives in a rural area of Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has three children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business in a small farmland. He grows rice primarily and sells his agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, he has been in this type of business for more than thirty years. On average, he is able to make earnings of 3.00 USD a day. Currently, he would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of travelling. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Kolokika

texts.en: Kolokika is a 55 year old mother with 6 children. She owns and operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her village to earn a living. Kolokika has requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery in the near future using her profit. Kolokika joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, yeast

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 52, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has two children in total. 

To support her family, Than manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $2 a day. 

To supplement her income, Than came up with a new business idea. She wants to raise cows to sell. However, her insufficient capital doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy cows. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standards. 

Than is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Elsa Lidia

texts.es:
Elsa, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, todos son mayores de edad.

Elsa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde que era pequeña le ayudaba a su madre con los quehaceres de la casa, es madre soltera, pero con sacrificio y esfuerzo ha logrado darle lo necesario a sus hijos.- Además de dedicarse a los quehaceres de su casa, tiene una tienda con productos de la canasta básica y frutas y verduras; por las tardes vende antojitos como tamales, enchiladas, atoles, pupusas, de esta manera es que ella puede logra obtener ingresos para poder sostener a su familia.

El financiamiento del préstamo Elsa, lo utilizara para colocar una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde y para comprar maíz, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, para su tienda. Con estos productos ella fortalecerá más su tienda, y con la granja tendrá otra fuente de ingresos.

Elsa, siempre ha deseado mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia, otro de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad.
texts.en:
Elsa, who is 44 years old, went to school through sixth grade. She is the single mother of three children; all are adults.

Elsa does the domestic tasks. Since she was little, she helped her mother with the household duties. She is a single mother, but with sacrifice and effort she has managed to give the necessities to her children. In addition to doing the household duties, she has a store with products for the basic family food basket and fruits and vegetables. In the afternoon she sells snacks such as tamales, enchiladas, atole (a cornflour drink), and pupusas (filled corn tortillas). In this way she can manage to obtain income to be able to support her family.

Elsa will use the financing from the loan to set up a little farm with chickens to fatten and to buy corn, beans, sugar, and rice for her store. With these products, she will further strengthen her store, and with the farm she will have another source of income.

Elsa has always wanted to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Another of her dreams is to see her children graduate from the university.

loans.use: to set up a little farm with chickens to fatten and to buy for corn, beans, and rice for her store

loans.name: Erick Mauricio

texts.es:
Erick, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos, de las edades de 10 y 8 años, los cuales estudian.

Erick, trabaja de albañil desde hace tres años, aprendió este oficio cuando trabajaba de ayudante de albañil, fue así como aprendió ahora puede trabajar para sostener a su familia.- Además de trabajar de albañil, tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta básica desde hace dos años, su pareja es quien está a cargo de la tienda, de todas estas actividades generan los ingresos suficientes para los gastos del hogar.

Erick, utilizara el crédito para comprar productos como maíz, frijol, jabón, azúcar, arroz y verduras; este tipo de productos son los que sus clientes buscan más y él no la cantidad suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de ellos, es por eso que quiere compra más de estos productos, de esta manera ayudará a sus clientes y mejoraran sus ganancias.

Erick, sueña con comprar un carro, para poder desplazarse más fácil a su lugar de trabajo y para llevar la mercadería a su casa.
texts.en:
Erick, 26, studied up to fifth grade. He lives with his life partner who works as a housekeeper, and he has two children, ages 10 and 8, who are studying. 

Erick has been working as a bricklayer for three years; he learned the profession when he worked as a bricklayer’s apprentice, and now he is able to work in order to support his family.

In addition to working as a bricklayer, he has had a basic foods store for two years.  His life partner runs the store, and with all these activities they make enough income for their household expenses.

Erick will use the loan to purchase products such as corn, beans, soap, sugar, rice, and vegetables; these are the kinds of products that his customers look for most, and he doesn’t have enough to satisfy their requests. That is why he wants to purchase more of these products, as in this way he will help his customers and improve his earnings. 

Erick hopes to purchase a car so that he can travel to his work site more easily, and carry merchandise to his house.

loans.use: to purchase products such as corn, beans, soap, sugar, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, gravel, etc., to construct a room in order to expand her business premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows and goats to rear and sell later for a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized metal sheets, wood, etc. to repair the roof and to build cement pillars in his house

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la pesca.
El es emprendedor, paciente, constante, independiente, resposanble y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Pampachililaya’ situado a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca; lugar donde se encuentra el albergue comunitario; sitio donde se puede descansar para después abordar los botes a motor rumbo a la Isla, el trayecto a la isla se realiza a través de laberintos de Totora (planta acuática típica del lago), de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar. 
Angel es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la pesca; cada día al salir el sol; el se adentra al lago Titicaca y realiza la pesca de las variedades; carachi, mauri, ispi y trucha. “la pesca con red es bastante sacrificada porque tenemos la costumbre de dejar la red en las profundidades a manera de trampa para luego, después de varias horas recogerla, con el fin de no dañar las profundidades que son el alimento y refugio de nuestros peces…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pescadería. El desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca porque las que tiene se encuentran dañadas y necesita renovarlas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Angel solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes para pescar y así lograr su sueño de tener una pescadería.
texts.en:
Angel is a 25 year old man, he lives with his partner, has no children and his business is fishing. He is enterprising, patient, constant, independent, responsible and hardworking. He does his work in the “Pampachililaya” community, located on the banks of the Sacred Lake Titicaca, where the community shelter is located and where one can rest to later board the motorboats heading to the island. The journey to the island is through mazes of Totora (typical aquatic plant from the lake); it’s cold and with a dry climate, the temperature varies during the day between 2 and 12 degrees Celsius, at a height of 3,800 meters above sea level.

Angel is of dark complexion, sort stature, short black hair and a slim physique. His mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken locally, and Spanish, for general culture and the commerce he engages in. His life is shared with his partner, who makes a living from agriculture. They live in their own home, built with adobe and a tin roof; it has electricity and well-water services. His business is fishing; each day when the sun rises, he enters Lake Titicaca and fishes for a variety of fish, such as Carachi, Mauri, Ispi and Traut. “Net fishing is very demanding work because we are accustomed to leaving the net in the depths of the lake as a trap, so that after several hours, we can pull them up without damaging the bottom of the lake, which houses and feeds our fish…” he comments.

His dream is to have a fishery. He would like to purchase fishing nets, because the ones he has are damaged and he needs to renovate them. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the one year that he’s been doing business. These are the reasons Angel is requesting the loan, to purchase fishing nets and in this way achieve his dream of owning a fishery.

loans.use: purchase fishing nets and thus achieve his dream to own a fishery

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Gemma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan is a 27-year-old single man who lives with his family in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He has completed a University education. Due to high unemployment rates in the country, Marwan couldn't find a job to look after his family. He didn't give up but decided to start his own business. For many years, Marwan has been operating a small gift shop in the middle of the capital city of Sana'a. Marwan couldn't meet all the demands of his customers because his capital is small and he needs to enlarge his business. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 399,700 YER from AMB in order to purchase a variety of items for his gift shop.  Marwan hopes to open another branch in addition to the first one.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items for his gift shop.

loans.name: Marleny Esperanza

texts.es:
Marleny, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar en la universidad porque no tenía los recursos económicos suficientes, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Marleny, es comerciante, vende ropa en su casa y también sale a vender por las calles, es así como ella ayuda con los gastos de la casa, con el apoyo de su esposo es como ella ha logrado poder tener este negocio.-Decidió dedicarse a este negocio, debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes para abastecer las necesidades básicas de su hogar, no tiene horario de trabajo fijo.

Marleny, utilizara el crédito para comprar 1 docena de camisas para niño, 1 docena de ropa interior para dama y caballero, de esta manera podrá continuar con su negocio y apoyar a su pareja.
 
Marleny, sueña con tener una boutique de ropa, para no tener que salir a vender la mercadería por las calles.
texts.en:
Marleny is 21 years old and studied up until the end of high school (Bachillerato). Marleny was unable to continue on to university as she didn't have sufficient financial means. 

Marleny has a partner who makes a living in agriculture, they have a two year old son. 

Marleny is a merchant, she sells clothes in her home and also on the streets, in this way she is able to help with the household costs, she has been able to start this business with her husband's support. Marleny made the decision to start this business as her husband's wages were not enough to cover their basic household costs, he doesn't have fixed work. 

Marleny will use the loan to buy a dozen boys shirts, and a dozen each of men's and women's underwear. This will support her to continue with her business and support her partner. Marleny dreams of owning a clothes boutique, so she will no longer have to go out on the streets in order to sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy a dozen boys shirts, and a dozen each of men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is a 60-year-old married rice farmer with two grownup children, who lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Her husband is 60 years old and is also a rice farmer. The two children are working in the factory. Together, they can make approximately USD 12 each day. Phat would like to earn additional income to support the family, so she has decided to apply for a loan to buy clothes to sell to the factory workers. With this loan, she will be able to run another business and improve the family's finances. In the future, she is going to expand this business and to save money to build a ground-floor room.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila works hard to support her family. Lucila is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lucila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lucila has been in this business for 15 years now.

Lucila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: A resident of Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province, Khorn is a 35 year-old married woman with three children. All of her children are in secondary school. They need to support the family and send her children to school, so Khorn has been operating a small grocery store at home for 15 years. She has also been doing rice farming and her husband works as a construction worker, in order to earn additional incomes. They are able to keep 5 USD per day for their savings. Khorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles. The previous two loans allowed the family to live in better conditions. Leading her group, Khorn is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buy stock for her grocery store. She hopes to earn more profit from her store.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: 32 years of age, Thoeurn is a wife and a mother of two young kids. They are residing in a rural village of Dambae district in Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, Thoeurn has been planting cassava for 14 years, while farming rice during the rainy season. Thoeurn is with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the second time. A leader of her group, she is seeking for a 1,500,000 KHR loan for her cassava plantation. The loan will be used to hire workers to plow the land and to buy cassava stems for planting. Her goal is to expand her cassava plantation.

loans.use: to hire workers to plow the land and to buy cassava stems

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amalia is 50 years old now.

Amalia has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Amalia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kimthim's Group

texts.en: Kimthim is a 28-year-old mother of a little child who is under the age of six. Together with her husband, they are living in a small village of Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province. To finance the family's expenses, they have been farming rice for nine years, and her husband is a construction worker when they are not farming. They manage to save roughly 4 USD per day. Kimthim has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles, including this time. She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farming. She wishes that her farming will keep growing and earning lots of profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 32 years old and single with two children. With two children who are still in school, Ailen works very hard to provide for them.

Ailen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, bread, noodles, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

Ailen has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, bread, noodles, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, etc

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Orlando de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de una variedad de productos como: hamacas, cosméticos, productos de belleza, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is 68 and lives in a house with his wife. For 10 years, he's made a living selling a variety of products such as: hammocks, cosmetics, beauty products, etc. His shop is located in the town market and has many clients, whose purchases help him to move forward. 

He asks for this loan to buy more products wholesale, so he can continue his sales and thus obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale hammocks, cosmetics, beauty products, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc., to build a perimeter wall at her house.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Somos Mas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “las mujeres somos más” está conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras. Este es el caso de Yesseny de 29 años de edad, separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Yesseny es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de ropa, Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de más polos, blusas, shorts y vestidos. El anhelo de yesseny es tener su propio local. El grupo “Las mujeres somos más” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Yesseny, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo morado ella se encuentra con su hijo el viste polo a rayas.
texts.en: The communal bank "Las Mujeres Somos Más" (we women are more) consists of 7 entrepreneurial women. This is the case with Yessseny, who is 29 years old. She is separated with two dependent children. Yesseny is a persevering woman who with much effort and dedication tries to raise her family. She now sells clothing. She feels happy every time she improves her economy. At this time, she is applying for a loan to purchase more knit shirts, blouses, shorts, and dresses. Yesseny's dream is to have her own shop. The group "Las Mujeres Somos Más" is grateful to Kiva for the help offered. Yesseny is the first one on the right side, and she is wearing a purple shirt. She is with her son, who is wearing a striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy more knit shirts, blouses, shorts, and dresses

loans.name: Mary Mendelyn

texts.en:
Jea is 20 years old and is the third of the three children in the family. Her mother Mary Mendelyn, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her beauty parlor business in the Philippines.

Jea is studying for her bachelor of science in elementary education and is currently on her third of this four-year course.

Mary Mendelyn is borrowing PHP 8821.29 to pay the tuition fee of her daughter Jea for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Jea plans to be gainfully employed so she could help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is 44 years old and married with three children. Analita  works very hard to provide for them.

Analita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Analita has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Analita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a widowed woman, 60 years old with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Celia has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Celia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely works hard to support her family. Mely is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Mely requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, needles, etc. for her business.

Mely has been in this business for seven years now.

Mely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, needles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 29 years old and has seven children, five of whom are in school. She is married.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Annabelle has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Charlita works hard to support her family.

She has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell firewood.  Charlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming vegetable business.

Charlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sophanna's Group

texts.en: A Tbaung Khmum resident, Sophanna is a 36-year-old married woman with three secondary school children. To support the family, she has been doing rice farming, while her husband works as a construction worker. She has been doing this for 18 years. The family is able to save approximately 7 USD each day. Her second time being with Kiva’s partner (VisionFund) and the leader of her group, Sophana is applying for a 1,400,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice field. She hopes that the profit from rice farming will help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khit's Group

texts.en:
Khit is an elderly woman who is married and has four children. Only one of them is living with her and her husband. They are residing in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province. 

She has been growing rice for 43 years to support the family. She manages to save roughly three USD each day. This is her third time being with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she is a creditable client. 

Khit is the leader of her group of three and is applying for a 1,300,000 KHR loan to buy good quality rice seed and to hire workers to plough the field for her rice farm. She hopes that the profit will help to finance her rice farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice seed and to hire workers to plough the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is married with two children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, es casada y su esposo es jornalero, siembra granos básicos como maíz, frijol y hortalizas, es madre de tres hijas, la primera de ellas tiene 29 años de edad y ya se acompañó, la segunda hija estudio hasta bachillerato y ayuda en los oficios de su hogar y la tercera también estudio hasta bachillerato y actualmente trabaja como secretaria en una alcaldía.

Concepción, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar aves de corral (pollos), tiene alrededor de 1 año trabajando en esta actividad.- Aprendió de su madre a trabajar con pollos, la pequeña granja de pollos la tiene en el mismo terreno donde está su vivienda.

Concepción, necesita el crédito para comprar concentrado para pollos y comprar una maya para cercar el terreno donde están las hortalizas.

EL sueño de Concepción, es que sus hijas sigan estudiando en la universidad.- También, desea arreglar el área donde están las hortalizas.
texts.en:
Concepcion, 58, studied until the first grade, and is married. Her husband is a day laborer, sowing basic grains like corn, beans, and greens. She has three daughters, the first of whom is 29 years old and already accompanied, the second daughter finished high school and now helps with the household business, and the third also finished high school and currently works as a secretary for the mayor's office.

Concepcion makes her living doing domestic work and caring for farmyard birds (chicken). She's done this for about a year, having learned from her mother to work with chickens. She has her small chicken farm on the same land where she lives.

Concepcion needs this loan to buy chicken feed and a net to fence in the land where her vegetables are. Her dream is for her daughters to continue studying in the university. Also, she wants to fix up the area where she has her greens.

EL sueño de Concepción, es que sus hijas sigan estudiando en la universidad.- También, desea arreglar el área donde están las hortalizas.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and a net to fence in the land where the vegetables are.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana tiene 50 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. For 10 years she has owned a small store located in her house. She has many customers thanks to her good prices and her kindness when selling. With what she earns with her sales she is able to pay some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soda drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc. and in this way to have more income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soda drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Armando
