texts.es: Carlos de 48 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la venta de pescado y mariscos, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, vive en casa propia con u grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más productos por mayor ya que ese es su único medio de trabajo para generar sus ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 48 years old, has worked for 30 years selling fish and shellfish. He sells his products in the areas surrounding the zone where he lives, and he has many customers because of his good prices. With the sales that he makes, he manages to cover some of the expenses that arise in his household. He lives in his own house with his family group. 

He is applying to Apoyo Integral for a loan to be able to buy more products wholesale, since this is his only means of work to generate his income and to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish wholesale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
From Coron Palawan, Rosalie has been an active member of CCT for years now, and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. At the age of 61, she is already a widow and is helping her children provide for their daily needs. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Rosalie owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams come to reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, an egg,  toothpaste or even ice tube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She desires to earn more profit so she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance. She will also use the loan to pay for the maintenance of her apartment and van which she is operating for rental service.

Rosalie meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her variety store and to pay for the maintenance of her van for rent and apartment.

loans.name: Estela Esperanza

texts.es: Estela de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella posee desde hace 13 años una carnicería ubicada en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas carnes por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi pueda tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Estela, who is 41 years old, lives in her own house with her three children and her husband. For 13 years she has had a butcher shop located in the municipal market. She has many customers because of her good prices. With the sales that she makes, she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household. She is applying for a loan to purchase more meat wholesale in order to be able to continue with her work, since this is her only source of income, and thus she can have a better quality of life, together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat wholesale

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 10 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Orbelina trabaja en un comedor desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. La vivienda de Orbelina está en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena, grava, etc. y de esta forma cambiar el material de la vivienda y encementar el piso de la misma que en la actualidad es de tierra.
texts.en: Orbelina is 39 years old, and she lives in her own house along with her little 10-year-old son, who is in school. Orbelina has worked in a dining hall for a long time, and this is how she brings sustenance to her household. Orbelina's house is in bad condition. For this reason, she has decided to apply to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, gravel, etc., and in this way replace the material of the house and cement the floor, which is now dirt.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, sand, gravel, etc., to repair the conditions of her house and to cement the floor.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old and married with nine children. With five children in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Elena has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit was born in the frontier village of Achajur in the Tavush region, and after getting married in the same village, she lives here now with her nice family. Anahit and her husband managed to establish a cute farm, which many years brings them income and helps them to solve the minimum needs of their family. They have a son who is married, and he and his wife live with them. All of the family is engaged in farming and agriculture. 

Anahit says she greatly enjoys her work with her farm livestock such as cows and chickens, and most of all she likes her plot of land on which she established a nice orchard. Here she has apple, plum, fig, and persimmon trees. She sells the vegetables from her land such as beans, potatoes, cucumbers and corn with all of her farm products at the city wholesale market during the week.

Anahit is asking for a loan in the amount of 500 AMD in order to purchase pigs to start swine breeding and also to buy fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy pigs to start swine breeding and also to buy fodder for all her farm livestock

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business like fish net, bamboo, etc.

Genalyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her businiess like fish net, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie works hard to support her family. Leslie is married with one child and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Leslie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net and other materials for fishing.

Leslie has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is married with three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Yuheab's Group

texts.en: Residing in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province, Yuheab is a 43-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are secondary school students and her dependents. Yuheab has been farming rice for 25 years in order to manage the family's budget, while her husband works as a construction worker. They are able to save 3 USD each day. Yuheab is not new with Kiva’s partner (VisionFund). She has successfully repaid two of her former loans. Leading her group, she is seeking a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farming. She wishes that the profit from it will keep her farming business going.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thul's Group

texts.en: Thul is from Banteay Meas district, Kampot province. 51 years of age, she is married and has three children. She has been a rice farmer for 31 years. She also raises a pig. Her income is 3 USD per day. Thul has been a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, twice now. Her previous loan enabled her to send her children to school. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR to build a toilet. She wishes for her children to be healthier with a proper toilet so that they can study well.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono is 42 years of age, very passionate and diligent about farming. He is considered a pacesetter when it comes to farming in his village of Chebiemit in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Having done mixed farming for the past five years, he has gained much experience and he offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. He is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. 

Kiprono enjoys generating income from selling milk, his harvest, and produce from his farm. He finds dairy farming very fulfilling but the main challenge he faces is not being able to properly feed his dairy cows. 

He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan he will be able to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage to feed his cattle. The chaff cutter will aid his cattle in digestion and will prevent his dairy cattle from rejecting any part of their food. Proper feeding of cattle is one of the most important factors in maintaining high yield production of milk. Through proper feeding, his cow will produce more milk and this will translate to more profits and improved living standards. 

When he was asked how this loan will benefit his family, Kiprono said “more income.” Profits from the loan will be used in fully repaying the loan and improving standards of living for his parents, family, and his school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Mirna De Jesus

texts.es: Mirna de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija y su nieta, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros,  desde hace 6 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, esta solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en: Mirna is a 39-year-old single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter and her granddaughter.  She makes a living selling women's and men's undergarments.  For the past 6 years she has been in this trade and has many steady clients with which she can keep her business afloat.  With the earnings she gets from her sales she is able to cover some of the household costs.  She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of undergarments at various prices, styles and colors so that she is able to maintain more clients and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of women's undergarments of different prices, styles and colors.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 18,000 PHP. This new loan will be go toward additional groceries, toiletries and beverages that she needs in order to expand her product inventory. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Angelita wants to become a successful businesswoman and to manage more business to increase her income and be able provide for all of her children's needs. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como cosméticos, esmaltes, ganchos para el cabello, shampoo, tientes para el cabello, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her immediate family.  She makes a living through selling personal products.   Her business is located in the market close to her home, and she had many clients due to her variety of products and good prices.  With her earnings, she is able to get ahead. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more products like cosmetics, nail polish, hair clips, shampoo, and hair dyes, etc. and with these, be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, nail polishes, hair clips, shampoo and hair dyes, etc.

loans.name: Belma

texts.en:
Belma is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like eggs, canned goods, biscuits, salt, groceries, etc.

Belma has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from an eatery.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like eggs, canned goods, biscuits, salt, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lisel

texts.en:
Lisel is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Lisel works very hard to provide for them.

Lisel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, bread, etc.

Lisel has been in this business for two years.

In the future Lisel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, bread, etc

loans.name: Elesenia

texts.en:
Elesenia is 55 years old with five children. With one child in school, Elesenia works very hard to provide for them.

Elesenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Elesenia has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Elesenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Yaem's Group

texts.en:
49-year-old Yeam is living in a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is a widow with five children and three of them are living with her. 

To finance her family, she has been farming rice for 31 years. Her children also help out by being factory workers. Yeam had never been with Kiva’s partner (VisionFund) before. Now leading her group of three, she is requesting a 1,500,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farm. She hopes that her rice will have higher yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chan Thou's Group

texts.en: Chanthou is 28 years old and married with two young children. They all are residing in a rural village of Stoeung Sen district, Kampong Thom province. To support the family, she has been washing dishes at local restaurants for four years, while her husband drives a motor taxi. They manage to earn 5 USD per day. A new member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Chanthou is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy equipment to open a small business in repairing tires. She hopes that the business will be profitable and keep expanding.

loans.use: to buy equipment to open a small business in repairing tires

loans.name: Kombo Group

texts.en:
Ester, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still at school.  She has been selling fish for 21 years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be one of many loans that Ester has taken from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to continue increasing the fish stock, buy a deep freezer for storing the fish and cold drinks, open a food shop and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, build a house, buy a TV set, a deck, a radio and she covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase the fish stock and meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of extending her business.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, Kombo, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the fish stock and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 41, lives in a house with her two daughters. For 10 years, she has made a living making and selling pupusas [a traditional Salvadorian dish: handmade corn tortillas filled cooked pork, cheese, and beans]. Her store is located near her home, in an area with a lot of foot traffic, and her profits help to solve various household problems. 

Maria is asking for a credit to buy cooked pork meat, cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients, and thus be able to continue her very profitable work.

loans.use: to buy cooked pork meat, cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 48 years old and has four children who are still in school.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods like hot dogs, sausage and other frozen products.

Evangeline has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods like hot dogs, sausage, and other frozen products

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 47 years old and married with six children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Sarah has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, toothpaste, etc. 

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fearly

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fearly works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Fearly is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Fearly has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 46 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, cereals, milk, juice, canned goods, noodles, sanitary pads, etc., to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, milk, juice, canned goods, noodles, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, cereals, milk, juice, canned goods, noodles, sanitary pads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Meloysa

texts.en:
Meloysa is 33 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Meloysa has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 32 years old and has four children. Elisa is married and has three children who are in school.

Elisa is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 67 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, coffee, etc.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, coffee, etc

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está soltero y vive junto a sus padres y 4 hermanos menores que él.

Humberto, junto a su padre siembra hortalizas como pepino, tomate, ejote etc. Tiene aproximadamente 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que es tan importante para ellos, porque es de allí que obtienen el dinero para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.- Los cultivos los están cerca de su casa, por eso ellos siempre están muy pendientes, también trabaja de jornalero. Su padre, sus hermanos y Humberto trabajan en coordinación para obtener más provecho a todos sus cultivos.

Gracias al financiamiento del crédito anterior Humberto, logró cubrir las expectativas de las cosechas que esperaba y también obtuvo mayores ganancias económicas. Ahora, necesita el nuevo crédito para comprar fertilizantes, comprar abono y pago de mano de obra, para los nuevos cultivos.

Humberto, sueña con tener un sistema de invernadero para cultivos, pues en el invierno es bien difícil tener cultivos, porque hay mucha plaga que afecta a los cultivos.- También, desea poder construir su propia casa y  no descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Humberto, age 21, studied up to the fourth grade.  He is single and he lives with his parents and four younger siblings. 

Humberto and his father grow vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, green beans, etc.  He has been doing this work for approximately four years. It is very important for them, as that is how they earn the money to cover their household expenses.  The crops are close to their house, so they are always tending them.  He also works as a day laborer.  Humberto and his father and brothers work in coordination with each other in order to obtain a higher yield from all their crops. 

Thanks to the previous loan, Humberto was able to meet the expectations he had for the harvest, and he also obtained more earnings.  Now he needs a new loan to purchase fertilizer and compost, and to pay workers for the new crops. 

Humberto dreams of having a greenhouse system for the crops, as it is very difficult to have crops during the winter because there are many pests that affect them.

He also hopes to build a house of his own, and keep open the possibility of continuing his studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and prepare the soil to cultivate cucumbers; he already has the seed.

loans.name: Anyango

texts.en:
Anyango is a married woman and has two kids who both attend school. Together they live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

Anyango has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread and an overlock machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread  and an overlock machine

loans.name: Cheang's Group

texts.en:
An elderly villager of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cheang is married with six children. All of her children are already forming their own family and living elsewhere. 

To earn a living, she has been a rice farmer for 42 years and it enables her to save 5 USD daily. For three cycles now, she has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice field. She hopes that her rice farm will be more productive, so that they can have more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chan Veasna's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of Stoeung Sen district, Kampong Thom province, 30-year-old Chanveasna is married with a small child who is under six years old. To help the family budget, Chanveasna has been farming rice and has been a tailor for four years. In addition, she raises a pig for extra income. She can earn around 5 USD per day. Chanveasna has not been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before. Currently leading her group of two, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy piglets and pig feed. Her wish is for her family's living standards to be upgraded.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en: Ratha is a 44-year-old villager of the Borseth district of Kampong Speu province. He is married and has five children; four of them are living with him and his wife. To support the family's finances, he has been a rice farmer for 26 years. His children also help with the family budget by being factory workers. They manage to save 4 USD every day. One of his children has just completed her high school diploma and she is preparing for the university. He is seeking a loan to pay for her tuition fee. She is interested in studying law for her bachelor's degree. He hopes that his daughter will have a better future in the field of law.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
26-year-old Kosal is a married woman with two young children. Her family is living in Sangke district of Battambang province. 

To earn a living, she has been a construction worker. She manages to save about 3 USD each day for future uses. She is a leader of her group that contains three members. 

This is her fifth time being with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 KHR to buy construction materials for sale. She hopes that her business will go well with the new stocks.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 25 years old, and lives with his wife in Gaza. He has been working at the municipal at his town. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan to build it again. He plans to buy basic materials like stones and cement. He would be able to pay the workers, and this loan will help him to renovate his home. 

Ahmad is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to go back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for them.

loans.use: to buy basic materials like stones and cement to renovate his home.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is grateful that she was granted a 50000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to fund her daily living expenses. 

Maria Victoria would like to apply for another 50000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help her and her parents daily needs. 

Maria Victoria dreams of having a bigger general store and of being financially stable. She prays for good health and a quiet life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Euberta

texts.en:
Euberta is 59 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Euberta works very hard to provide for them.

Euberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like candies, condiments, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Euberta has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Euberta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like candies, condiments, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 48 years old, married and has three children.

Juvy is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs, sacks of feed and vitamins.

Juvy has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs, sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 41 years old and has five children. Nenita is married and has four children who are still in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 49 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them. Flora runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.  

Flora requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, condiments, etc. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angeline is 24 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Angeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Angeline requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lazat

texts.en:
Lazat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1990. She is living in a remote district. She is single. She is a teacher. She teaches at a secondary school. Lazat likes her job. She is well-known among teachers. The students are all satisfied from her teaching. 

Unfortunately, Lazat became sick. She needs to get treatment. She requested financial support from Kiva project to get treatment in a medical clinic.

loans.use: to get treatment in a medical clinic

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 28-year-old single man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the transport business and at the same time works as a farmer, which has added more income for him. He is faced with challenges of limited capital that hinder the progress of his business. However, he has hopes of constructing a residential home. 

He has asked for a loan to buy land for settlement.

loans.use: to buy land for settlement.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 60 years old and married with six children. Geronima works very hard to provide for them.

Geronima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like cup noodles, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Geronima has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Geronima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like cup noodles, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mohruhsor

texts.en:
Mohruhsor is a brave woman. She was born in 1993. She is living in a remote district. She is married. She has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Her husband could not feed their family alone. Mohruhsor decided to help her husband and started her own business. 

For almost five years, she has done business in the agricultural sphere. She is planting agricultural products in their yard. It was hard for Mohuhsor at the beginning of her activity. But she got experience year by year and now she knows her activity well. 

Mohruhsor is asking for financial support to buy seeds for planting and making better their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, cigarettes, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Gina has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, cigarettes, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 38 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Liza has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling wood.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Providing jobs, increasing available crop output, buying a home, paying for his children’s education – these are just some of the things going around Wilson’s mind. 

Wilson is a 46-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Litein, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with a lovely family. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 10 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business, or side hustle, as they like to put it. 

From Kiva lenders, Wilson is seeking a loan worth KES 65,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Wilson access to a loan that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Wilson’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 58 years old and a widowed woman from Sagarejo district. Eter lives with her son. Eter is a tailor and gets orders to sew clothes and generates income. 

She decided to increase her income and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase clothes and will resell them with a price markup. This will increase her income along with her activities. Eter awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Jesus Santiago

texts.es:
Jesús, de 46 años de edad, no tiene ningun grado de estudio, es casado y su esposa se dedica a las tareas domesticas del hogar, sus hijos no viven con él porque ya estan acompañados.

Jesús, es el encargado de limpieza y mantenimiento en una iglesia catolica de su pueblo, la oportunidad de trabajo se le presentó hace pocos meses.- Además, de ese trabajo en sus tiempos libres, se dedica a trabajos de albañilería en la misma zona.
 
La vivienda en la que vive la familia de Jesús, es de bahareque y sin piso, es por eso que desea remodelarla para tener un mejor espacio fisico. 

El préstamo lo solicita para comprar cemento, arena, y piedra, para hacer el piso de concreto, esto le favorece para que su familia este mas cómoda.- El trabjo será realizado por el mismo, para reducir el costo por mano de obra.

Las condiiones de vida de su familia no son las más adecuadas, es por eso que en un futuro, desearia mejorar su vivienda por completo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 46 years old and never went to school. He is married and his wife is a housewife. His children don't live with him, because they are already married. 

Jesús is responsible for the cleaning and maintenance of a Catholic Church in his town. The work opportunity arose a few months ago. In addition to that work, in his free time he does construction work in the local area. The home where Jesús' family lives is of wattle and daub construction, and has an earth floor. That is why he wishes to do renovations, in order to have a better living  space. 

The loan is to buy cement, sand and gravel for installing a concrete floor. This will enable him to provide greater comfort for his family. He will do the work himself, in order to reduce the cost for labor.

His family's living conditions are not the most adequate, and that is why someday he would like to renovate his home completely.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel for installing a concrete floor in his home.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly, 34, is a smallholder farmer residing a rural area, an agricultural town in western Uganda. He is arguably among the most successful farmers in the area. He rears cows on a small scale. 

Back in 2000, Elly began practicing traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was growing only half an acre of maize per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for himself. So when the family enlarged, he resorted to cattle farming, stating with a few cows which have later increased to give him profit. He has been challenged by limited income which has affected his growth and profitability. 

Having come to know about UGAFODE through a friend, he decided to come to UGAFODE for a financial boost. He will buy more cows using the loan. He is hardworking and resilient. He appreciates the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is 24 years old, and lives with his wife and son in Gaza. He has been working as a lawyer for three years. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it again, but he lost all his property, so he is trying now to take the first step until he can get back to his normal life.

For these reasons, he has requested a loan to purchase cement and other building materials, and also pay for the workers to start rebuilding. Tareq is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to get back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials, and also pay for the workers to start rebuilding his house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Edwena

texts.en:
Edwena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edwena is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Edwena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edwena requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Edwena has been in this business for six years. In the future, Edwena would like to save enough money so she is able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Helen has been in this business for 19 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish. She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a 38-year-old resident of Taguig City, Philippines and she is married to Rico. She and her husband, who is also a utility worker, manage their household while operating the businesses. They work hard for their children, to provide income for their everyday needs.

Lita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week. She also earns well as a water distributor.

To help her continue the operations of her businesses, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She will also buy gallon jugs, which she uses as water vessels for easy distribution of water in the community.

Lita dreams of expanding her business and of having more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and direct-selling products, and also to purchase more gallons of water for the maintenance of her water business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used his previous loan to renovate his rentals. He is still in the motorcycle transport business and he also owns a salon and a phone charging business to supplement his income. 

He is faced with the challenges of competition and bad roads that cause constant mechanical breakdowns. 

However, he hopes to build a fully furnished home as a special gift for his family. John has asked for a loan to buy building materials like timber and sand.

loans.use: to buy building materials like timber and sand.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia, who is in her late 20s, is married with three children who are still at school.  She has been running a salon business since 2008.  She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Theresia's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the salon stock and she also started selling cosmetics.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan.  She used the profits to pay school fees and loan dues. She also paid her school fees as she is also at college and she covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment to meet her customers' requirements and to increase her cosmetics stock.  She dreams of extending her salon.

Theresia will make sure she pays her loan due at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment to meet her customers' requirements and to increase her cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Irene Grace

texts.en:
Irene Grace is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Irene Grace is 28 years old and one of her children is in school.

Irene Grace has a coconut vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional coconuts to sell.

Irene Grace has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has been blessed with one child who attends school. Together with her husband, they live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Her name is Elsa, 56, and she is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Prospero, her business partner, and has four children with their own families.  She manages their household while operating a business. They work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Elsa owns and oversees operation of her jeepney service. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are constantly packed with passengers. Jeepneys offer one of the cheapest ways of getting somewhere. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the Second World War and are still seen throughout the Philippines, in many colors and all over the place. Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army who occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands in the Philippines.The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Elsa is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use for repairs and maintenance of her jeepney. It is very important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her husband drives her jeepney so she is assured that her jeepney is well taken care of. Her earnings from their service helps fund their everyday needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Elsa hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful to be able to save for their old age. She prays for the safety of her husband and their passengers. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Maria de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: María is 63 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her husband. For the last ten years, María has made a living selling “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) at a business that she runs out of her home. Located in a much-frequented area, the business provides profits that allow María to cover some household costs. María is applying for a loan in order to buy pork scratchings, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients. She can then continue with her work, which provides her with a good income.

loans.use: to buy pork scratchings, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Argentina

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos desde hace 3 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes pero la calidad del producto y los buenos precios,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas variedad de electrodomésticos por mayor para surtir su negocio y asi poder generar mejores ingreso.
texts.en: Ana is 53 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her husband and daughter. Ana has been making a living selling electrical appliances for three years. She runs her business out of her home and has many customers as a result of her offering good quality products at accessible prices. Ana uses her profits to cover some household costs. She is applying for a loan in order to buy a greater variety of electrical appliances in bulk and stock up her business. Ana will be able to earn a higher income with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of electrical appliances in bulk.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for five years now.

Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the loan he acquired, he bought spare parts for resale. He is still dealing in the sale of spare parts, the business he started with the hope of employing himself. He is faced with challenge of low capital that hinders the growth of his business. In-spite of this, he has hopes of having good rentals that will enable him to generate more income. John has asked for another loan to buy building materials like cement and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, es madre de dos hijos y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y también siembra hortalizas como tomate y chile.

Rosa, trabaja en la cría de peces, tiene un año y medio de realizar esta actividad, aprendió junto a su esposo, por medio de una institución que les apoyo con asesoría técnica y como es una actividad que no requiere de tanto trabajo físico, decidió seguir produciendo.- Antes, solo se dedicaba a trabajar con sus padres en los oficios del hogar, la pecera la tiene en el mismo terreno de su casa, junto a ella trabaja su esposo y sus hijos cuando no asisten a clases.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos quintales de concentrado de engorde para los peces y 6 bolsas de cemento para hacer otro estanque, para producir más peces.- El crédito ayudara a comprar los insumos para alimentar adecuadamente sus peces y que así alcancen un peso considerable, para luego sacarlos a la venta y  poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Los sueños de Rosa, son ampliar su producción de peces y apoyar a sus hijos en la formación académica, para que en el futuro puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and completed high school. She has a partner, who makes a living growing basic grains such as corn and beans, and vegetables such as tomatoes and chilies. Rosa is a mother to two children.

Rosa herself makes a living raising fish. She has been doing this work for a year and a half, having learned the trade with her husband at a learning institution that supports them with technical assistance. Given that the work does not require much physical work, Rosa decided to keep raising fish. Previously she only helped her parents with household chores. Rosa keeps her fish on the same land where her house is. She works with her husband, and their children when they are not in school.

Rosa needs this loan in order to buy two hundredweights of fish feed, and six bags of cement to construct another pool so as to have more fish. This loan will help Rosa to buy the necessary supplies to give her animals adequate feed so that they gain weight. She can then sell them and pay household costs.

Rosa’s dreams are to increase fish production and to support her children with their education so that one day they may have a profession.

loans.use: to buy two hundredweights of fish feed, and six bags of cement to construct another pool.

loans.name: Walter Alberto

texts.es:
Walter, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, su pareja se dedica a prestar servicios domésticos en casas particulares y viven con los padres de su pareja.

Walter, decidió dedicarse al trabajo de mecánica automotriz por la necesidad y pocas opciones de empleo en la localidad; a través del tiempo ha logrado adquirir gran experiencia, que le garantiza seguir mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida en su familia, su lugar de trabajo está muy distante y tiene un horario de lunes a sábado, viaja con su jefe para reducir el costo de transporte.

Uno de los requisitos para seguir trabajando como mecánico según su jefe, es tener herramientas propias para ejercer su labor con mayor eficiencia, pero a Walter, le hace falta una parte del equipo base, es por eso que solicita el crédito, para comprar llaves de tuercas, desarmadores, tester, entre otras herramientas, que le permita realizar su trabajo sin ninguna complicación.

Lo que más desea Walter, es tener su propio taller, además, sueña con tener su propia casa, con condiciones básicas para que su familia este en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Walter is 40 years old and has a ninth-grade education. He has a partner, who is a domestic servant, and two children. The family lives with Walter’s parents-in-law.

Walter decided to become a mechanic because he needed to earn a living and there were few job opportunities in the local area. He has gained a lot of experience, allowing him to continue increasing his income and improving his family’s living conditions. Walter’s workplace is very far from his home. He works from Monday to Saturday, travelling with his boss in order to reduce transport costs.

According to Walter’s boss, one requirement to continue working as a mechanic is to own your own tools so as to work efficiently. Walter, however, does not have everything that he needs and is therefore applying for this loan in order to buy wrenches, screwdrivers and other tools. This will allow him to work without having any problems.

What Walter most wants is to own his own garage. He also dreams of having his own simple house so that his family can live in a pleasant place.

loans.use: to buy wrenches, screwdrivers and other tools.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jerlyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Jerlyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 34 years old with four children. With three of the children in school, Jennylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jennylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Jennylyn has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Jennylyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, and groceries

loans.name: Saroeurb

texts.en: An Ek Phnom villager, Saroeurb is 35 years old and married with three young children. Two of the children are in school, while another one is below 6 years of age. She has been a fish seller at the local market for eight years. She also feeds fish and grows vegetables for sale. With her seventh loan as a member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, Saroeurb is pursuing a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation. She hopes that it will financially help her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plantation

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business.

With the loan of Kes 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Toeur's Group

texts.en: A mother and a wife, 43-year-old Toeur is living with her family in a rural village in Thmor Koul district, Battambang Province. All of her three children are working but they are still living with her. Her main source of income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her husband is a construction worker. They manage to save around 3 USD daily. Previously, Toeur successfully repaid the three loans she had with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Now leading her group, she is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy potash and rice seed and to hire workers to plough her rice field. She wishes that her family's financial status will be improved.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed and to hire workers to plough her rice field

loans.name: Shirley Rosa

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, este negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas corporales, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará a tener una mayor diversidad de productos de belleza esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Shirley is 22 years old, she is single, and she lives in her family’s house in the district of  Oyotún, which is a rural zone located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, the citizens work in agriculture and livestock.
She works in the sale of beauty products, this business is located in her home. She has 10 years of experience in the business, with loyal clients who have good personal and work references for her. She asks for a loan to purchase a large quantity of beauty products, such as perfumes, body creams, among other, to increase stock in her business. 
The loan will help her to have a large diversity of beauty products, with the goal of expanding her business and satisfying the needs of her clients, which will generate more income and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of beauty products, such as perfumes, body creams, among others, to increase stock in her business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 49 años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia, el se dedica a vender huevos en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 16 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es muy vendible y lo da  a un precio muy accesible el quiere acrecentar su negocio comprando huevos al por mayor por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo antes mencionado y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 49 years old. He lives with his daughter in a house that they own. For the last 16 years, his occupation has been to sell eggs in different neighborhoods, which are close to his place of residence. With the income he obtains from sales, he manages to cover the expenses in his home. He has a lot of costumers, because his products are in demand, and he sells it at a very accessible price. He wants to increase his business by buying eggs at wholesale. This is why he asks for a loan, which will allow him to purchase the eggs, and be able to obtain a better income, to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Jancy Valentina

texts.es:
Jancy, de 33 años de edad, solo estudio hasta educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al comercio de oro y plata, tiene dos hijos.

Jancy, trabaja como ama de casa, támbien trabajo en la junta de agua de su comunidad y le ayuda a su pareja en el megocio.

El crédito lo necesita para terminar de construir su casa y para comprar más oro y plata par el negocio de su esposo.

Jancy, sueña con tener su casa terminada, que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y sean profesinales para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jancy, 33, has an elementary education.  She lives with her partner who sells gold and silver, and she has two children.  Jancy is a homemaker and also works for the water board in her community, as well as help her partner in his business.

The loan she needs is to build her house and buy gold and silver for her husband's business.  Jancy dreams about her finished home and her children getting an education to become professionals and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To finish building her house and to buy gold and silver for her husband's business.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, es casado, junto a él vive su esposa y una hija, su manera de obtener ingresos para salir adelante con su familia es elaborar prendas de vestir y trabajar como vigilante por las noches, no tiene apoyo económico del extranjero, el negocio lo fundo hace 10 años y su padre le enseño a desempeñarlo, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a hasta las cinco de la tarde, su esposa es un apoyo fundamental para cumplir con todo lo que su  negocio demanda.
Está solicitando capital para comprar una máquina de coser nueva, agujas, hilos, botones, etc., al tener todo lo necesario para elaborar las prendas de vestir ofrecerá a sus clientes calidad, puntualidad y un buen servicio.
Manuel sueña con tener estabilidad económica, dar a su familia un estilo de vida más digno y tener un nuevo taller con instalaciones más amplias.
texts.en:
Manuel is married and lives with his wife and daughter.  He earns a living for his family by making clothing and also works as a security guard at night.  He has no economic support from overseas.  He established his business ten years ago and it was his father who taught him all about it.  Manuel works eight hours a day until 5:00 p.m.  His wife's support is fundamental for him to meet the demands of his business.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, buttons, etc. to have all he needs for his tailoring business and to meet customer demand for quality, timeliness and good service.

Manuel dreams of having economic stability and giving his family a more dignified lifestyle, as well as a new workshop with more space.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, buttons, etc. for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro de 48 años de edad se dedica a la venta de yinas (sandalias) desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, gracias a las ventas que realiza puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar,  Milagro ahora vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de yinas por mayor ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Milagros, who is 48 years old, has made a living selling flip-flops for three years. Her business is located in the municipal market in a very busy area, which is why she has many customers. Thanks to the sales that she makes, she can cover the expenses in her home. Milagros now lives in a house that she owns with her two sons. She is asking for a new loan for the purchase of flip-flops at wholesale, as her sales have been very good, and this way she will be able to keep having a better income.

loans.use: to purchase flip-flops at wholesale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is 53 years old and happily married to Honesto, who is a retired seaman. God has blessed them with six loving children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Teodora owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price. Then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Teodora desires to promote her family's standard of living through all her hard work in the business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and direct selling products so she can increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.name: Belly Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada, tiene 3 hijos de 17, 12 y 7 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción o albañilería. 

Carolina, se encarga de los oficios del hogar y cuidar de sus hijos, cuando sus hijos no estudian ayudan a su padre con las labores de construcción. 

El préstamo es para colocar el piso y reparar el techo de su vivienda, ella quiere terminar su casa, debido a que tiene 9 años que la comenzó a construir y todavía le falta terminar un cuarto. 

Ella sueña con terminar su casa, antes que sus hijos terminen el bachillerato, para dismunuir los gastos y poder darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Carolina, 34, has an eighth grade education.  She is married and has three children, ages 17, 12 and 7.  Her husband works in construction and bricklaying.  Carolina does domestic tasks and takes care of the children.  When they are not in school they help their father with construction work.

The loan is to put down flooring and repair the roof of her house.  She wants to finish the house they started building nine years ago since there is still a room left to be built.

Her dream is to finish the house before the children graduate from high school.  This is to reduce costs and be able to give her children a university education.

loans.use: To put down flooring and repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Cristina Dolores

texts.es:
Cristina, se dedica a la venta de plantas ornamentales, es madre soltera y toda la responsabilidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante la ha enfrentado sola, actualmente vive con su hija menor, los demás hijos ya tienen un hogar y son independientes, el negocio lo realiza por la necesidad de tener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hija, la venta de plantas ha sido  su fuente de ingresos principal, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y sale a vender de manera ambulante 4 días a la semana.
Invertirá canastas, alambre, bolsas, semillas y tierra abonada, tendrá más plantas para vender y tener ingresos, espera que su estilo de vida cambie y poder cancelar la deuda sin dificultades.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para diversificar más la mercadería del vivero.
texts.en:
Cristina sells ornamental plants.  She is single and has the full responsibility of providing for her children.  She currently lives with her youngest daughter.  The other children are independent and have their own homes.  Cristina is in business to earn enough income to cover her and her daughter's expenses.  Selling plants has been her main source of income.  She runs the business from home and goes out four days a week as a street vendor.

She plans to buy baskets, wire, bags, seeds and potting soil to have more plants on hand and earn more income.  She hopes her lifestyle changes so she can pay off debt more easily.  Her dream is to continue working and diversify the merchandise in her nursery.

loans.use: To buy baskets, wire, bags, seeds, and potting soil to have more plants to sell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, es un agricultor que cosecha granos básicos, para el consumo familiar y para vender, de esa forma tiene los recursos económicos para disminuir las carencias familiares, es acompañado, vive con su esposa, dos hijas y dos nietos, sus hijas ya están acompañadas, el oficio lo práctica desde que era muy joven y sus padres le enseñaron a realizarlo.
El financiamiento le permitirá comprar una maquina picadora de zacate proveniente de sus cultivos, venderá el producto a los dueños de las ganaderías de la zona para generar mejores ingresos y resarcir su deuda.
Sus principales sueños son dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Orlando is a farmer who grows basic grains for family consumption and to sell.  He is able to earn enough income to cover family needs.  He lives with his wife, two married daughters and two grandchildren.  Orlando has been in agriculture since he was very young, having learned from his parents.

The loan will allow him to buy a hay cutting machine so he can sell hay from his crops to livestock farmers in the area and generate more income to pay off debt.

His main dream is to give his family better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: To buy a new hay cutting machine so he can sell hay to livestock farmers in the area.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 31 years old and married with four children. With three of the children in school, Lanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, candies, groceries, etc.

Lanie has been in this business for three years now.
